characters: MR. POTATO HEAD MRS. POTATO HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A train races across the desert. MOVE IN on an ARMORED CA Suddenly, the roof blows open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money bags fly out. ONE-EYED BART (Mr. Potato Head) follo

dialogues.speaker: ONE-EYED BART
dialogues.text: Money, money, money! Ha! Ha! Ha! Bart stashes the loot. Suddenly, a lasso yanks his arm of

dialogues.speaker: ONE-EYED BART
dialogues.text: Hey! The lasso lifts him off his feet. He falls, dazed. A figure approaches -- WOODY. He pins Bart with his boot.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: You got a date with justice, One-Eyed Bart!

dialogues.speaker: ONE-EYED BART
dialogues.text: Too bad, Sheriff -- I’m a married man. A WAR CRY. Woody looks up.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ai! Ai-ai-ai-ai-ai-yah! A Ninja warrior, ONE-EYED BETTY (Mrs. Potato Head), flips down the train roof, wielding a sword and nun-chucks.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: One-Eyed Betty! Woody handsprings away. He gets to the end of the Caboose Betty hits him with her purse. He teeters, then falls.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa... Ahhh...! Bart and Betty laugh, peek over the edge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TILT UP to find Woody, riding BULLSEYE, JESSIE at the rei

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: I believe you dropped something, Mister!

dialogues.speaker: ONE-EYED BART
dialogues.text: Jessie?!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: You've reached the end of the line, Bart. Bart pulls out a remote detonator.

dialogues.speaker: ONE-EYED BART
dialogues.text: I always wanted to go out with a bang! Ahead, a huge trestle bridge spans a canyon. ZOOM to REVEAL -- The middle of the bridge is loaded with dynamit Bart laughs, hits the detonator. The bridge explodes. Woody, Jessie, and Bullseye gasp.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Oh no!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: The orphans! WHIP PAN -- A train car of TROLLS lean out the windows. One-Eyed Bart cackles.

dialogues.speaker: ONE-EYED BART
dialogues.text: Hate to leave early, but our ride is here. HONK-HONK! A pink Corvette, driven by the three ALIENS, pulls up alongside the train.

dialogues.speaker: ONE-EYED BART
dialogues.text: It’s me or the kiddies, Sheriff! Take your pick! The Potato Heads leap off the train into the Corvette. They speed off. Woody looks at the out-of-control train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ride like the wind, Bullseye! Bullseye runs up next to the speeding locomotive.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Hold him steady... Woody stands, then leaps from Bullseye into the locomotiv

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Woody, hurry! Woody turns a gear, pulls the brake. Train wheels lock. Sparks fly. Woody looks ahead. POV -- The train skids toward the severed rails. Bullseye and Jessie skid to a stop at the canyon edge. Too late. Woody and the train plummet over the edge. Bullseye and Jessie are horrified.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: No...! From deep in the canyon, a FLASH and RUMBLE. Then, the entire train rises into the sky. Holding it from below is BUZZ LIGHTYEAR.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Glad I could catch the train! Woody leans out the front.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Now let’s catch some criminals!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: To Infinity... And Beyond!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, hand-painted sign reads: Border Crossing One Mile Outlaws Welcome  WHIP PAN -- The Corvette speeds past. The Outlaws laugh gleefully. Bart kisses his loot. The Aliens see something in the sky, point...
Buzz flies out of the sun, firing his laser. The Corvette is sliced in half. The halves fall away. The Outlaws tumble into a heap. Woody and Jessie step up. Buzz lands nearby, laser poised

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Reach for the sky!

dialogues.speaker: ONE-EYED BART
dialogues.text: You can’t touch me, Sheriff! I brought my attack dog with a built-in force field! Bart WHISTLES. From above, SLINKY springs down the canyon walls, coils crackling with energy. He circles the gang, bites his tail. An ENERGY BUBBLE forms around them.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Well, I brought my dinosaur, who eats force-field dogs!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Yo-Dee-Le-Hi-Hooo00000000! The Earth trembles. Cracks form. The ground bursts open. A giant REX emerges, BELLOWING. He leans toward Bart, lets out a fearsome ROAR. A shadow. Rex stops. An intense HUM. Everyone looks up. An enormous, pig-shaped spaceship hovers above them.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Evil Dr. Porkchop!!! We FLY UP to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. PORKCHOP (Hamm) sits on the bridge, sporting a bowler

dialogues.speaker: EVIL DR. PORKCHOP
dialogues.text: That’s Mr. Evil Dr. Porkchop to you! Bart, Betty, Slinky, and the Aliens are suddenly beamed u Hamm flips open a switch. A red button: DEATH BY MONKEYS. He pushes it. The ship’s belly swings open. A yellow barrel is dropped. The barrel falls. It explodes into a mushroom cloud of crazed red monkeys. Woody, Buzz and Jessie flee. The Monkeys come after them. Rex ROARS. The Monkeys swarm over him, taking him down. Woody, Buzz and Jessie are overtaken and pinned down. The spaceship’s snout rotates and opens. A giant laser cannon powers up with a deafening HUM. Bart LAUGHS and reaches for a button marked with a skull and crossbones.. Jessie turns away, eyes shut. Bart LAUGHS louder. Buzz turns away. Bart CACKLES -- finger on the trigger. Woody grimaces...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ANDY’S ROOM - DAY Andy imitates One-Eyed Bart’s LAUGH. On Woody and Buzz. Andy’s hands move Woody as he “talks”.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ANDY, (AS WOODY)
dialogues.text: Buzz! Shoot your laser at my badge!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ANDY, (AS BUZZ)
dialogues.text: Woody, no! It’ll kill you!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ANDY, (AS WOODY)
dialogues.text: Just do it! Andy presses Buzz’s laser, makes a ricochet sound -- PSH -- off Woody’s badge and traces a line into the air... ...Where Hamm, the Potato Heads and the Aliens perch on a winged cardboard box, crudely fashioned into a spaceship, that dangles from the ceiling. Andy hits the carton -- PPPKOOOOOSHHH!!! The Toys tumble to pillows on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: HANDHELD
dialogues.text: MOM’S hand pushes open a door. Andy, 8, in his cowboy hat jumps around making EXPLOSION NOISES. He’s turned his room into a Western “set” complete with a Tinkertoy trestle bridge, a Barrel of Monkeys, etc.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ANDY
dialogues.text: (as Woody ) . You're going to jail, Bart. Camera ZOOMS IN. Andy looks up, stops.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: No, no...! Keep playing! Just pretend I’m not here. Suddenly, MOLLY, 2, toddles in, knocking over Tinker Toys

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Oh, no! Molly...!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ANDY
dialogues.text: No, it’s okay, Mom! It’s... A 50- foot baby from outer space! She’s on a rampage! Run for your lives! Andy races around. Chaos, laughing. Buster enters, BARKIN The CAMERA PIVOTS UPSIDE-DOWN, revealing Mom’s face.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Does the red light mean it’s going? The TAPE GLITCHES and we JUMP TO... BEGIN MUSIC -- “You’ve Got A Friend In Me”  INT. ANDY’S KITCHEN - DAY - HANDHELD CAMCORDER POV Molly sits in a high chair, party hat on, eating cake. Camera PANS Andy's Toys, wearing party hats. End on Andy, holding Woody, stuffing cake in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Come on, say ‘Happy Birthday’ to Molly...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ANDY
dialogues.text: (mouth full) Happhy Brffday!

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Oh, charming. Andy holds Woody up to CAMERA, cake crumbs flying.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ANDY, (AS WOODY)
dialogues.text: Happhy Brffday!!!

dialogues.speaker: JUMP TO
dialogues.text: INT. ANDY’S ROOM - DAY - HANDHELD CAMCORDER POV Mom pencils a line above Andy’s head onto the door frame.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Look how tall you’re getting! Andy steps away and beams.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP TO
dialogues.text: INT. ANDY’S ROOM - DAY - HANDHELD CAMCORDER POV Andy holds Woody against the door frame, marks a line abo Woody’s head. ZOOM OUT to reveal lines and labels for all the toys, including for “Slinky” and “Slinky’s Butt”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy gives Woody a piggyback ride.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP TO
dialogues.text: INT. ANDY’S ROOM - DAY - HANDHELD CAMCORDER POV Andy holds Buzz towards camera, shoots his laser.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: “Buzz Lightyear to the rescue!”

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (AS WOODY)
dialogues.text: Good work Buzz! Andy makes Buzz and Woody high five.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP TO
dialogues.text: INT. ANDY’S ROOM - NIGHT - HANDHELD CAMCORDER POV Andy lies in a pillow fort, surrounded by toys, eating fr a huge bowl of popcorn, and watching an off-screen TV. He stuffs popcorn in Rex’s mouth, turns back to the TV. His eyes widen. The popcorn tumbles out of Rex’s mouth.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ANDY’S FRONT YARD - DAY - HANDHELD CAMCORDER POV Andy rockets Jessie and Bullseye around the front yard, while Mom struggles to keep him in the FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP TO
dialogues.text: INT. ANDY’S ROOM - DAY - HANDHELD CAMCORDER POV Andy, laughing, spins around, falls on his bed, pulls his toys close -- holding Woody, Buzz and Jessie in the warm, glowing embrace of a child’s innocent and boundless love. The song FADES on “Our friendship will never die...”

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay -- places, everyone! C’mon, get in position! INT. TOY CHEST, ANDY’S ROOM - DAY Dark, crowded. Toys crammed together. Light seeps in. Nervous, backstage jitters. They speak in HUSHED TONES.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Wait -- I can’t find my other eye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's foot is in my face...

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: It’s mine! Give it back!

dialogues.speaker: ALIENS
dialogues.text: You saved our lives! We are eternally grateful! Potato Head groans. Buzz sits by the rim. Jessie climbs u

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Buzz, mind if I squeeze in next to ya?!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Yes! No! I mean...! Why would I mind?! Squeezing next to... You! He laughs, nervous. She grins. Finally, he turns away.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is it hot in here?

dialogues.speaker: REX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Here they come! The Toys clamber to the rim and gaze out. POV -- SARGE and two ARMY MEN slip in the room, dragging something in a gym sock. The Army Men arrive at the chest. Woody peers down.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Sarge! You got it...?!

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Mission accomplished! The Toys are thrilled. The Army Men hoist the sock up.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Careful...! Careful!!! Buzz turns the sock upside-down. A cell phone slides out. Toys gather around.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All right, guys. We got one shot at this. Everyone ready?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: We're ready, Woody! Let’s do it!  10

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Buzz -- make the call. Buzz flips open his wrist cover. A phone number is writte inside. Jessie pulls out a cordless phone, leans close to Buzz. Buzz chuckles, nervous. Jessie dials the phone. Woody tosses the cell phone to Rex. Jessie gets to the last digit, hits it. Silence. Suddenly, the cell phone RINGS. Rex yelps. Buzz, Jessie and Woody peer over the rim. FOOTSTEPS on th stairs.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Target is on approach. Woody’s eyes are fixed on the door.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Just like we rehearsed it, guys... The door opens. ANDY enters but we only SEE his jean-clad legs. He scans the room, zeroes in on the toy chest. He lifts the lid REVEALING... Andy is a teenager. His hair is long and his voice deep, but he has the same kind face. He looks down, puzzled. The Toys lie, lifeless, amid sports equipment and clothin The phone RINGS again. Andy’s hand rummages. Woody hugs the cordless as Andy's fingers pass by and fin the cell phone. He pulls it out. The phone is stuck in Rex’s arms. Andy pulls. Rex clings. Andy finally yanks the phone loose.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Hello...? CLOSE ON -- Woody, holding the phone. He closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hello...?! Anyone there? Andy hangs up, turns.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Molly, stay outta my room!  11

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I wasn’t in your room! Andy scoffs, looks down at Rex in his hand. Rex lies frozen, smiling -- eager to be played with. Andy drops Rex in the box, shuts the lid, heads out.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Then who was messing with my stuff?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It wasn’t me...! He departs, closing the door -- CLICK. CREAK -- Woody and Buzz push the chest open, share a look The other Toys climb out.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Well, that went well! They spill out onto the floor. The room has changed -- rock posters, guitar, skateboard, other teen detritus.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: He held me! He actually held me!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Oh, this is just sad.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Who are we kiddin’? The kid’s seventeen years old! Woody and Buzz jump down, exchange a glance. Buzz nods. Woody waves his arms.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Guys, hey, hold up! We need a staff meeting! Everyone? A staff meeting! GROANS of boredom.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Not again...!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, come on! Slink? Gather everyone up!

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Uh... We are gathered, Woody! The Toy Community is a lot smaller. Woody rolls with it.  12

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Okay. First off -- we all knew Operation Playtime was a long shot...

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: More like a misfire!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: ..-But we’ve always said this job isn’t about getting played with. It’s about...

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: .--Being there for Andy. We know.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: But we can try again, right? Woody looks at all of them. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I’m callin’ it, guys. We’re closin’ up shop. Gasps. Everyone is crushed by this news.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Andy's going to college any day now... That was our last shot. Mrs. Potato Head begins to sniffle. Buzz steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: We're going into Attic Mode, folks. Keep your accessories with you at all times -- spare parts, batteries... Anything you need for an orderly transition. Potato Head steps up.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: “Orderly?” Don’t you get it?! We’re done! Finished! Over the hill!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, now come on, guys! We all knew this day was coming! Buzz, in FOREGROUND, sees something off-screen, frowns. POV -- Sarge and the Army Men climb up onto Andy’s desk. The other Toys keep arguing.  13 HAMM (0.C. Yeah, but now its here!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Look, every toy goes through this! No one wants to see their kid leave!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Hey! Sarge! What are you doing?! Everyone turns. Sarge and his last two Soldiers climb to the window sill.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: War’s over, folks. Me ‘n the boys are movin’ on.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Moving on...?!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: You're going AWOL?!

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: We done our duty. Andy’s grown up.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER ONE
dialogues.text: And let’s face it -- when the trash bags come out, we Army guys are the first to go.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Trash bags...?!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Who said anything about trash bags?

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: It has been an honor serving with you. Good luck, folks. Sarge straps in tandem with Soldier One. They leap. Their parachute opens and the wind carries them off.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER TWO
dialogues.text: You're gonna need it...! He jumps and flies off too. The Toys are stunned.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No, no... Wait...! Wait! Wait!!!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: We're getting thrown away?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No one’s getting thrown away!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: How do you know?! Jessie begins to panic.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: We're being abandoned...!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: We’ll be fine, Jessie!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: So why did Sarge leave?!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Should we leave?!

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: I thought we were goin’ to the attic!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Oh, I hate all this uncertainty...! Woody turns, waves his arms.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa! Hold on! Quiet!!! No one’s getting thrown out, okay?! We’re all still here, aren’t we?! (beat) I mean, yeah, we've lost friends along the way -- Wheezy and Etch and...

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Bo Peep...? Woody nods, stoic.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Even... Even Bo. All good toys who've gone on to new owners. But through every yard sale, every spring cleaning, Andy held on to us. He must care about us or we wouldn’t be here. You wait -- Andy’s gonna tuck us in the attic. It’1ll be safe and warm..

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: ..-And we'll all be together. 14  15

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Exactly. There’s games up there, and books... And, and...

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: The race-car track...

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: The race-car track. Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: And the old TV...!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: There you go -- the old TV! And those guys from the Christmas decorations box! They’re fun, right? The Toys shrug, MURMUR in semi-agreement. Woody softens.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And someday -- if we're lucky -- Andy may have kids of his own...

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: And he’ll play with us then, right? Woody looks at Rex, unable to say “yes”.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: We'll always be there for him.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Come on, guys! Let’s get our parts together, get ready, and go out on a high note. The Toys disperse.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: I'd better find my other eye...

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Where'd ya leave it this time? She puts a hand over her empty eye socket.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Someplace dark. And dusty! Hamm turns to Rex.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: C’mon. Let’s see how much we're goin’ for on eBay...  16 Woody watches as the Toys trudge off.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. Andy’s gonna take care of us. I guarantee it.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DRESSER
dialogues.text: Woody climbs up, surveys the room -- posters, guitar, textbooks. He turns to a cork board where Andy's high school graduation photo is pinned. He lifts it to find... A SNAPSHOT shows an eight-year-old Andy wearing a cowboy hat and posing with Woody and Buzz and all of Andy's toys Woody gazes at the halcyon past he can never return to. Buzz steps up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: You guarantee it, huh...?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I dunno, Buzz. What else could I say?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Whatever happens, at least we’ll be together. CLOSE ON -- The SNAPSHOT of young Andy.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: For Infinity and Beyond... FOOTSTEPS on the stairs. Woody and Buzz turn.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Can I have your stereo?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ‘Cause I’m taking it with me! The Toys scramble back into the toy chest. Andy enters with Molly close behind.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Can I have your computer?  17

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Your video games?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Forget it, Molly! Molly sighs, walks off. Andy starts typing on his laptop. Andy’s Mom enters carrying cardboard boxes and trash bags

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Okay, Andy, let’s get to work here. Anything you're not taking to college either goes in the attic, or it’s trash. She picks up a box and writes “College” in magic marker. Andy stares at his computer.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Mom, I’m not leaving ‘til Friday!

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: C’mon -- it’s garbage day.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Mom...! She picks up his skateboard, puts it in the “College” box

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Look, it’s simple: Skateboard? College. Little league trophy? Probably attic. Apple core? Trash. You can do the rest. She tosses an apple core in a trash bag, hands it to Andy Molly opens the Toy Chest.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Why do you still have these Toys?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Molly, out of my room...!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Three more days and it’s mine...! She strides out the door.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Molly, you’re not off the hook either!  18

dialogues.speaker: THE TOY CHEST
dialogues.text: The Toys watch as Mom picks up a box, enters Molly's room

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have more toys than you know what to do with. Some of ‘em could make other kids really happy...

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: What kids...?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: The children at the day care. They're always asking for donations. Rex whispers.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: What’s “day care”?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Shhh...!!! Mom writes SUNNYSIDE on the box. Molly pouts.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: But, Mom...

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: No “buts”. You choose the toys you wanna donate. I’11 drop ‘em off at Sunnyside. Mom leaves. Molly sighs -- Moms! -- surveys the room. She picks up a xylophone, a Magic 8-Ball, puts them in the bo She picks up her old Barbie. MOLLY POV -- Barbie smiles, desperately eager to please. Molly, indifferent, tosses Barbie into the box, then buri her face in a “Teen” magazine.

dialogues.speaker: THE TOY CHEST
dialogues.text: Across the hall, the Toys react.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Poor Barbie...!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: I get the Corvette.  19 INT. ANDY’S ROOM - DAY Mom walks back and finds Andy still on his laptop.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Andy, come on -- you need to start making decisions.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Like what? She pulls open the toy chest.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Like, what are you gonna do with these toys? Should we donate ‘em to Sunnyside?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Maybe sell them online...?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Mom -- no one’s gonna want those old toys. They’re junk!

dialogues.speaker: THE TOYS
dialogues.text: Silently hear this bombshell. Mom lowers the lid.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Fine. You have ‘til Friday -- anything that’s not packed for college, or in the attic, is getting thrown out.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: “Whatever you say, Mom.” He stares at his laptop. She shakes her head, exits. Andy sighs, closes his laptop. He turns, surveys his room He rolls his chair to the toy chest and opens the lid. Inside are the Toys -- his old friends. They lie frozen, smiling, forever eager to play. Andy gazes at them, making a decision. Abruptly, he grabs a trash bag, snaps it open. He picks u the Toys -- Rex, Potato Head, Jessie -- tosses them in.  20 He pulls Hamm's cork, empties the change out, and dumps him, with rest of the Toys, in the trash bag. Then Andy picks up Buzz and Woody, looks at them. POV -- Buzz, grinning and heroic. Woody, smiling and loya TOYS POV -- Andy turns, tosses Woody in the College box. The Toys gasp. Andy drops Buzz into the garbage bag.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BAG
dialogues.text: Buzz is stunned and hurt. Andy cinches the bag closed and carries it from the room. Behind him, Woody pops up from the College box, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BAG
dialogues.text: It’s dim and crowded.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: What’s happening...?!!!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: We're getting thrown out, you idiot! That’s what’s happening!!! Woody jumps from the box, runs across the room, hides behind the door frame. Andy walks onto the hall landing, reaches up, and pulls open a trapdoor ladder that leads to the attic. Woody watches, relieved. Andy begins climbing to the attic. One rung... Two... Molly enters the hall landing, struggling with her box. It hits the door frame. A Magic 8-Ball falls out.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You need a hand?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I got it... Andy steps down, leaves the bag at the foot of the ladder grabs the 8-Ball. He helps Molly carry her box downstairs

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Here. So, you gonna miss me when I’m gone?  21

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: If I say ‘no’, do I still get your room?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Then, yes, I'll miss you. They disappear.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BAG
dialogues.text: The Toys are piled all over each other. Jessie is hyper- ventilating. Buzz looks around -- plotting his next move.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: I can’t breathe!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: This can’t be happening!!!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Quiet...!!!! What’s that sound? They all listen. A faint CREAKING.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LANDING
dialogues.text: The attic ladder -- spring loaded -- retracts, pushing th toy-filled trash bag out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BAG
dialogues.text: The bag is tipped over. The Toys tumble over each other.

dialogues.speaker: TOYS
dialogues.text: Whooaaaaa...!!!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LANDING
dialogues.text: The ladder pushes free and rises to the ceiling, retracti completely. Woody tiptoes into the hall toward the bag. Suddenly, Mom enters carrying a trash bag. Woody retreats Mom trips over the toy-filled bag, looks down -- irritate

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Andy...?! No answer. Mom sighs, picks up the toy-filled bag and exits, carrying it downstairs.  22 ANDY’S ROOM Woody -- at the door -- is electrified.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: That’s not trash! That’s not trash!! He steps back, mind reeling.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Think, Woody...! Think! Think! (an idea) Oooh! (whistles) Buster! C’mere, boy! C’mere! Off-screen PAWS and the JINGLE of a dog collar. Buster enters -- old, saggy, panting. Woody vaults onto his back

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, boy! To the curb! Hyah!!! Buster yawns and flops over, pinning Woody under him.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, Buster, no...! Woody grabs Buster by the jowls, pulls him backwards. Finally, Buster rolls over. Woody sits up, gasping. Off-screen, a door SLAMS. Woody turns. Woody rushes to the window, gazes out. POV -- Mom drops the trash bags at the curb. WHIP PAN -- Rumbling up the street is a garbage truck. Woody gasps.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BAG
dialogues.text: Mounting panic.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: We’re on the curb!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Oh, I knew it would come to this! Buzz grabs the side of the bag, tries to tear it open.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Pull, everyone! Pull!!!  23 EXT. ANDY’S HOUSE - DAY Woody grabs a pair of scissors, shoves them in his holste He lunges for the drainpipe, slides down, hits a gutter a tumbles into the bushes below. CRASH!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BAG
dialogues.text: The Toys follow Buzz’s lead, pulling the sides of the bag

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: It won't rip!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Ah, forget it! It’s triple-ply high- density polyethylene!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: There’s gotta be a way out!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Andy doesn’t want us! What’s the point?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (thinking) Point... Point... POINT!!! Buzz looks at Rex’s pointy tail.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE BAG
dialogues.text: The truck RUMBLES closer, two driveways away.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BAG
dialogues.text: The Toys follow Buzz, shoving Rex backwards.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Push! Push!!!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: I can hear the garbage truck!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE BAG
dialogues.text: The bag stretches. Rex’s tail is nearly through.

dialogues.speaker: REX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s getting closer-fffmmm! Rex is muffled by a mouthful of plastic.  24

dialogues.speaker: IN THE YARD
dialogues.text: Woody uses the scissors to snip his way out of the bush. The garbage truck approaches Andy’s driveway. Woody races out, dives behind the mail box post. The GARBAGE MAN is in head phones, playing air guitar, drummi the mail box. He empties a garbage can into the truck. Woody ducks from behind the post, plunges his scissors in a garbage bag. Garbage spills out: wrong bag. He tries another. No luck. As the Garbage Man turns, Woody ducks behind the post. Th Garbage Man grabs the last bags, tosses them in the truck He climbs on a running board, SLAPS the side. The truck shifts into gear and lurches off down the stree

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: As the truck rumbles off, Woody ducks from behind the mai box, runs after it. The truck pulls up at the next house. Woody hides behind a fire hydrant. The Garbage Man hops off the runner, yanks a lever. The truck’s compactor lowers, scoops up the trash bags. From behind the hydrant, Woody watches in horror. The compactor retracts, CRUNCHING the bags remorselessly.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Buzz...!!! Jessie...!!! A TINKLE. Woody turns. In Andy’s driveway, an upside-down recycling bin scurries on little feet into the garage. Woody sighs, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Toys cast off the bin. They are traumatized.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Andy threw us out...!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Like we were garbage...!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: “Junk”! He called us “junk”!  25

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: How could he...?! She SOBS on Mr. Potato Head’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (to himself) This doesn’t make any sense...! Jessie is furious.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: I should’'a seen this coming! It’s Emily all over again! She turns and scans the garage -- galvanized, determined.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Sarge was right...!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Yeah! And Woody was wrong!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! Hold on! This is no time to be hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: It's the perfect time to be hysterical!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: (hysterical) Should we be hysterical...?!!!

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Maybe! But not right now!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeeeeeeeeeeeeeee--hawwwwwwwwww...!!! Everyone turns. Jessie is smiling.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fellas -- I know what to do! They follow her gaze. In the hatchback of Mom’s car is Molly’s box of toys, marked SUNNYSIDE.  26 EXT. ANDY’S YARD - DAY Woody darts from a tree to a landscape boulder, sneaking towards the garage. He peeks out from behind a flowerpot.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: What the heck...?! WOODY’S POV -- The Toys clamber into the Donation Box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz stands outside the Donation Box as the other Toys clamber in. Jessie helps the Aliens up into the box.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: We should’a done this years ago!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Jessie, wait...! What about Woody?!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: He's fine, Buzz! Andy’s takin’ him to college! Now we need to go! Buzz looks at her and the others.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: You're right. Come on! He helps pass the Aliens up. Woody approaches, incredulou

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Buzz...?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Woody...!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: What’s going on? Don’t you know this box is being donated!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: It’s under control! We have a plan!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: We're going to Day Care!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Day Care?! What -- have you all lost your marbles?!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Didn't you see? Andy threw us away!  27

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No...! No, no, no! He was putting you in the attic!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Attic? So how’d we end up on the curb?!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: That was a mistake! Andy’s Mom thought you were trash!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Yeah! After he put us in a trash bag!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: And called us “junk”!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I know it looks bad but, guys, ya gotta believe me!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Sure thing, “College Boy”!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Andy’s movin’ on, Woody! It’s time we did the same. Jessie and the others duck in the box, pull the flaps shu

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Okay, out of the box! Everyone, right now! Come on! Buzz -- gimme a hand. We gotta get this thing outta here! He walks around and tries to push the box out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Woody -- wait! We need to figure out what’s best for every--... SLAM!!! The hatchback shuts. Buzz and Woody turn. Through the window, Andy’s Mom walks to the driver's seat, gets in. Woody and Buzz crouch down

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, great! Great!!! It’s gonna take us forever to get back here! The car lurches into gear and drives off.  28

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Toys have gathered around Barbie, who is sniffling. Mrs. Potato Head pats her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: It’s all right, Barbie. You'll be okay! Barbie nods, putting on a brave front.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Well... Molly and I have been growing apart for years, it’s just... I can’t believe she would throw me away! She breaks down again. Potato Head rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Welcome to the club, Toots! Suddenly, the box flaps open and Woody and Buzz vault in.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Okay, everyone, listen up... We can get back to Andy’s but we gotta move fast. We’ll hide under the seats ‘til we get home... The Toys react, incensed.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Get it through your vinyl noggin, Woody -- Andy doesn’t want us anymore!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: He was putting you... In the attic!!! Jessie goes toe-to-toe with Woody.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: He left us... On the curb! Buzz intervenes.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Alright, calm down! Both of you!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Okay, fine! Just wait’ll you see what Day Care’s like!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Why...?! What’s it like?!  29

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Day Care is a sad, lonely place for washed-up old toys who have no owners. Abruptly, Barbie bursts into tears.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Quite the charmer, aren't ya?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, you'll see! As soon as we get to Day Care, you'll be begging to go home. The car hits a bump and Woody tumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls into a modest day care center -- Sunnyside a cinder block building with bright, kid-friendly murals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy’s Mom pulls out the box, carries it across the lot. Inside the box, the Toys peer out the hand slots.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Can anyone see anything?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: There’s a playground...! Through fencing we SEE glimpses of kids running and playi with SHOUTS and LAUGHTER. The Toys look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: We hit the jackpot, Bullseye!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: So much for “sad and lonely”, eh?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Okay, calm down, guys. lLet’s keep this in perspective...

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Perspective?! This place is perfect!

dialogues.speaker: REX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Woody, it’s nice! See, the door has a rainbow on it!  30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy’s Mom is BUZZED through glass doors. A RECEPTIONIST behind a counter types at a computer while a small girl o the counter plays with a toy chimp. Andy’s Mom enters.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Hey, there!

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Wow! Haven’t seen you in ages...

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Just wanted to drop these old toys off. She puts the box on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is this Bonnie?! Look how big you are! The girl, BONNIE, looks up, then turns to her Mother, shy

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Say hi, sweetie!

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: How are your kids? Molly and Andy?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Not kids anymore. Andy’s going to college on Friday. Can you believe? The Receptionist opens the box. Bonnie tries to look in.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: You sure they won’t miss these?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Nah, they never get played with. Mom departs and the Receptionist folds up the box flaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Toys peek out as they are carried down a hallway.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: You see any kids...?

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Where’s she taking us?  31

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Box is placed on a counter. The Receptionist departs. In the box, the Toys step up and jostle for a view.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Look...!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Wow!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: What?! What is it?!!! TOYS’ POV -- An idyllic day care classroom, filled with t happy bustle of four- and five-year-olds, playing with to -- dinosaurs, a baby doll, a pink Teddy bear, a Ken doll. The Toys stare, agog. Rex jockeys for a peek.

dialogues.speaker: REX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aaah! I can’t see! A bell RINGS. A TEACHER opens the playground door.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERFLY ROOM TEACHER
dialogues.text: Okay, everyone, recess! C’mon! The kids CHEER and flood out on the playground. The Teacher turns off lights, shuts the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BOX
dialogues.text: Silence. The room is still. The Toys speak sotto.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: So, now what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: We go back to Andy’s! Anyone see an exit?

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Exit schmexit! Let’s get played with!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Careful! These toys might be jealous of new arrivals!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: I wanna see! It’s my turn! Rex presses in. The Toys react.  32

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Oooff...!!!

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Hey! The whole box tilts and falls off the counter -- SPLAT!!! The Toys spill out. They look up. Around the room, all the Day Care Toys stare back. A Jack In The Box pops up.

dialogues.speaker: JACK IN THE BOX
dialogues.text: New Toys! They all CHEER and burst into smiles. Jessie shakes hands with a ROCK MONSTER toy.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Well, howdy! Glad to meetcha! Buzz extends his hand to a ROBOT toy.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Buzz Lightyear, at your service. Hamm, Slinky and Barbie shake hands with an OCTOPUS toy.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Oh boy, oh boy, oh boy! Rex laughs, circled by adoring little dinosaurs. An Insect Man ACTION FIGURE helps Mrs. Potato Head get up

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Oooh, thank you! (reaches for his bicep) Oh, may I? Ohhh! He flexes obligingly. She feels his arm, GIGGLES. Mr. Potato Head looks on. He flexes his own arm. It sags. A Crane toy circles the Aliens. They gaze up, rapturous.

dialogues.speaker: ALIENS
dialogues.text: The Claw...!!! SFX -- HONK! HONK! Everyone turns.  33 A Tonka Truck races forward, then backs up in a quick 180 arc, revealing a large pink Teddy bear, LOTSO, in its bed Lotso taps a Tinker Toy cane and the truck bed rises, “dumping” him out. Like Bob Hope stepping off the links i Palm Springs, Lotso exudes an easy, cheerful charisma.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Well, hello there! I thought I heard new voices! Welcome to Sunnyside, folks! I’m Lots-o’-Huggin’ Bear! But, please, call me Lotso! Buzz steps up, offers a hand.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Buzz Lightyear. We come in pea... Lotso grabs Buzz, lifts him in a smothering hug.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: (chuckling) First thing you gotta know about me... I’m a hugger!! He releases Buzz, looks at the other Toys.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, look at y’all! You been through a lot today, haven’t you?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s been horrible!

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Well, you’re safe now. We’re all cast-offs here -- we been dumped, donated, yard-saled, second-handed, and just plain thrown out. But just you wait -- you'll find being donated was the best thing that ever happened to ya! Woody scoffs, but Rex steps up excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Mr. Lotso...? Do toys here get played with every day?

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: All day long. Five days a week.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: But what happens when the kids grow up?  34 Lotso steps to a wall of day-care class photos.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Well, now, I’1ll tell ya -- when the kids get old, new ones come in. When they get old, new ones replace them. You’1l never be outgrown or neglected. Never abandoned or forgotten. No owners means no heartbreak. The Toys are overjoyed. Even Woody is taken by this visio

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Yeee-hawww..!!!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: It’s a miracle!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: (to Woody) And you wanted us to stay at Andy’s!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Because we’re Andy’s toys! Lotso puts an arm around Woody.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: So you got donated by this “Andy”, huh? Well, it’s his loss, Sheriff! He can’t hurt you no more.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa... Lotso cuts him off.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Now let’s get you all settled in. Ken?! Where is that boy? Ken...?! New toys! A Ken doll appears in an upper window of a doll house.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Far out! Hey, hi, everybody! (to Lotso) Down in a jiff, Lotso! He rides down in an elevator and opens the door. ON KEN -- Slip-on shoes, double-pleated shorts, and an unbuttoned animal-print shirt that reveals his ripped abs He addresses the Toys with an air of boundless self-regar  35

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So. Who’s ready for Ken’s Dream Tour?

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Let’s show our new friends where they’1l be stayin’!

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Folks, if you wanna step right this-- He turns, sees Barbie. She looks up, sees him. Sparks fly. MUSIC swells. Destiny calls. They approach.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi! I’m Ken.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Barbie. (breathless) Have we ever me--...?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Huh-uh...! I would’ve remembered! (Barbie GIGGLES) Love your leg warmers.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Nice ascot. Lotso breaks the spell.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: C'mon, Ken! Recess don’t last forever!

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Right on, Lotso! This way everyone! He extends a gentlemanly arm. Barbie giggles, takes it.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: You got a lot to look forward to, folks -- the Little Ones love new toys! He leads them off. Rex, Buzz, and Woody trail behind.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: What a nice bear!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: And he smells like strawberries! Woody sighs, exasperated.  36 As they walk, Ken addresses the Toys like a tour leader.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Folks, if I can share, here at Sunnyside, we've got, well, just about anything a Toy could ask for. Lotso leads them past shelves of toy supplies.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Spare parts, super glue, and enough fresh batteries to choke a Hungry- Hungry Hippo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lotso flings open a utility closet, revealing a spa-like workshop in which smaller Toys fix up bigger Toys -- stitching rips, etc. The Toys gasp, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Think you're gettin’ old? Well, stop your worryin’!

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Our repair spa will keep you stuffed, puffed, and lightly buffed! An Elephant plushie is getting his belly re-stuffed. He SNEEZES. Stuffing flies everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CLASSROOM
dialogues.text: As the tour continues, Ken gestures to his Dream House.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And this, well, this is where I live -- Ken’s Dream House. It has a disco, it’s got a dune buggy... And a whole room just for trying on clothes.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: You have everything!!! Everything except someone to share it with. He looks down, walks off. Barbie sighs, about to faint. Lotso reaches a bathroom door at the end of the room.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: You need anything at all, you just come talk to me. Here we are...!  37 Lotso raps the door with his cane. It’s opened by a large baby doll, BIG BABY, with a lazy, drooping eye. Big Baby COOS, peers out at the Toys. They stare up in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, thank you, Big Baby. Why don’t you come meet our new friends? He throws an arm around Big Baby in Toy-solidarity.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Poor Baby! We were thrown out together, me n’ him. Abandoned by the same owner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lotso leads the Toys through a bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: But we don’t need owners here at Sunnyside! We own ourselves! We’re masters of our own fate...! We control our own destiny! Mr. Potato Head slips and falls, losing his parts.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh, watch out for puddles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lotso leads the Toys into a new classroom. The Day Care Toys here are scuffier and more toddler-appropriate.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: And here’s where you folks’1l be staying -- the Caterpillar Room! The Toys gaze up in awe. There’s kid stuff everywhere: tiny tables and chairs, finger paintings, wood blocks, banners of the alphabet, wire cubby bins, etc. The whole beautiful, child-centric universe of day care.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Look at this place!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: [Whistles]

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Holy moly, guacamole!  38

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Jackpot, baby!

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Whoa, puppy!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Wow! A TOY TRAIN weaves through the room, blowing its WHISTLE. The Potato Heads look around in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: (fighting tears) It’s so beautiful! Woody is awestruck. Something nudges him. A RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: What the...? He looks down. An old Fisher Price Chatter Telephone is bumping into him. Woody kneels down, friendly. Woody (CONT'D) Oh, hey, little fella...

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: How long’s it been since y’all got played with?

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: It’s been years!

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Well, just you wait. In a few minutes that bell’s gonna ring and you'll get the playtime you’ve been dreaming of.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Play! Real play!!! I can’t wait!!!

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Now, if you’ll excuse us, we best be headin’ back. Welcome to Sunnyside, folks! Lotso climbs back into the Tonka Truck. The Toys wave.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Thank you there, Buddy Boy!  39

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Take care, Pinky!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Mr. Lotso! Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Goodbye... ! Barbie turns to Ken -- an end-of-the-first-date moment.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Will I see you again?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Oh, I’1l see you tonight. In my dreams. She giggles. They stare. It’s like they could both spontaneously combust. At the bathroom door, Lotso waits.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Ken...! Let’s get a move on! Ken turns to Barbie, takes her hands.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Barbie, come with me! Live in my Dream House! I know it’s crazy! I know we've just met! Aw, heck -- you don’t know me from GI Joe. But when I look at you I feel like we were...

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: ...-Made for each other! They gasp, thunderstruck. Barbie turns, gazes to the Toys Jessie grins and winks. Mrs. Potato Head waves -- Go!

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Yay! She gives a leg kick. Ken pumps his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessssssss... Lotso calls again.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Ken...!

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Coming, Lotso!  40 Ken leads Barbie to the Truck and they hop in, giddy. Lotso taps his cane and the Truck roars off. Big Baby is the last to exit, closing the door -- CLICK -- behind the Through windows, children are heard LAUGHING and PLAYING. The Toys turn and wander toward the playground door.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Sounds like kids to me...!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Oh, I wanna get played with! Why can’t time go faster?!!!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: How many ya reckon are out there?!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Oh, they sound so sweet! Woody looks at them, knowing he’s fighting a losing battl

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Look, everyone, it’s nice here, I admit. But we need to go home...! The Toys glance at each other. Jessie steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: We can have a whole new life here, Woody. A chance to make kids happy again.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Why don’t you stay?

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Yeah, Woody! Stay with us!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Come on, Woodster!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: You'll get played with...!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Stay here!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: You can make a new kid happy!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I can’t! No, no! Guys, really, no! The Toys are taken aback. Woody struggles to stay calm.  41

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have a kid. You have a kid -- Andy! And if he wants us at college, or in the attic, well, then our job is to be there for him! Now I’m going home! Anyone wants to join me is welcome! C’mon, Buzz! He heads off. Buzz stays put. Woody turns back.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Buzz...? Buzz -- torn -- steps up to Woody, sober and gentle.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Our mission with Andy’s complete, Woody.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: What...?!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: And what's important now is we stay together.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: We wouldn’t even be together if it weren’t for Andy! Look under your boot, Buzz! You too, Jessie! Whose name is written there? The Toys stare at the ground. Rex pipes up.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Maybe Andy doesn’t care about us any more?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Of course he does! He cares about all of you! He was putting you in the attic -- I saw! You can’t just turn your back on him now! Jessie steps forward -- incensed.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Woody -- wake up! It’s over! Andy is all grown up! Woody stares, trying to contain his anger.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Okay, fine! Perfect! I can’t believe how selfish you all are.  42 Jessie glares back. No one moves.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So this is it? After all we’ve been through? Buzz steps forward, offers a handshake. Woody looks at Buzz. He fixes his hat, turns away. Buzz is stung. Woody walks to the hall door. Bullseye follows. WOODY (CONT’D) Bullseye, no. You need to stay! He moves on. Bullseye again tries to follow.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bullseye, no! I said stay! (softens) Look -- I don’t want you left alone in the attic, okay? Now, stay. Bullseye retreats. Jessie puts a consoling hand on him. KEYS in a LOCK. The Toys turn. BONNIE’S MOM (0.S.) Bonnie...? Bonnie! Woody looks at them, doesn’t know what else to say.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I gotta go. The Toys scatter. Woody hides behind the door just as Bonnie’s Mom enters. BONNIE’S MOM Bonnie? You in here? Woody sneaks out the door, into the hall. CLOSE ON -- Buzz and Jessie, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEACHERS CHAT at the end of the hallway. Woody peeks out from behind a garbage can, tip-toes into the hall, turns. A janitor cart approaches. Woody falls limp. The cart passes over Woody, leaving the hall empty. A whistling JANITOR pushes the cart down the hallway. TILT DOWN to FIND Woody holding the underside of the cart  43 WOODY POV -- He rolls through the lobby, toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: C’mon, c’mon... ...and veers into a bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, no...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Janitor cleans the sinks. Woody sneaks into a nearby stall. Looks up, sees an open window. He tears a square of toilet paper, places it on the seat, climbs up the tank lid, leaps to the toilet paper roll, jumps to the top of the stall, backs toward the window. At the sink, the Janitor looks in the mirror, starts.

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: What the heck? Woody freezes. The Janitor stares at the mirror, Woody in its reflection. RACK FOCUS -- The Janitor reaches up, wipes a stain off. JANITOR (CONT’D) That’s better. RACK BACK -- The window in the mirror. Woody's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody finds himself above the playground. Below, Bonnie plays hopscotch by herself. Her Mom walks over. BONNIE’S MOM Bonnie...? There you are. C’mon, honey. Time to go home. She leads Bonnie off. Woody climbs up a drainage pipe to the roof. He runs across the roof, stops at the edge. POV, PANNING -- A high wall surrounds the day care campus Woody frowns. A gust lifts his hat off, blows it away.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, no! No, no, no...!  44 His hat lands under a kite tangled on the roof top. Woody stares at the kite -- an idea.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Woody runs across the roof, kite over his head. He leaps and soars across the playground and over the wall. He glides down, makes a perfect landing, and laughs, pleased Abruptly, another gust hits, yanking him high in the air. Woody looks at the ground far below. The wind takes the kite higher still, dipping and swirling frenetically. Woody panics, wrapping himself around the kite’s cross-ba The bar snaps. The kite plummets. Woody tries desperately to flap the kite wings, but it doesn’t slow his fall. He crashes into a tree, hitting branches on the way down. He falls from the tree and stops -- eyes shut -- inches above the pavement. Opens one eye. Slowly, his pull-string lifts him upward.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (voice box) Reach for the sky! Woody dangles from a branch, trying to free himself. Bonnie approaches, playing hopscotch. Woody sees her, goe limp. She bumps into Woody, looks up. Looks around. She tugs Woody off the branch. His pull-string retracts.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (voice box) You're my favorite deputy! She smiles. HONK HONK! BONNIE’S MOM (0.S.) Bonnie!

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Coming! She shoves Woody in her backpack, zips it up, runs off.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACKPACK
dialogues.text: Woody is trapped.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, great!  45 As Bonnie and her Mom drive off, CRANE DOWN to REVEAL... Woody’s hat, lying on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullseye whimpers, stares at the door. Jessie consoles hi

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s gonna be okay, Bullseye.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Woody's going to college with Andy. It’s what he’s always wanted.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: He’s crazy! College is no place for a toy!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Toys are for play time!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Speaking of play time...! They’re lining up out there! Hamm, at the window, is spying on the playground.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: There must be dozens!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Ohhh...! I can hardly wait!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Places, everyone! The Toys scramble into play position. Buzz notices the Day Care Toys edging away from the door ducking, hiding, trembling, diving for cover. The bell RINGS. Kids SHRIEK. Footsteps THUNDER. Rex spreads his arms and runs to the playground door.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: At last! I’m gonna get played with!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Uh, Rex...?  46

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Come to Papa! BOOM! The door bursts open, swatting Rex across the room. A horde of squealing, hyped-up TODDLERS enter. The Toys go limp. Buzz closes his helmet. The toddlers descend on the Toys with SHRIEKS of delight. Toys are snatched up by eager, excited hands. A Boy and Girl stretch Slinky until his coil goes haywire A Boy smashes the Toy Train into a wall. A Girl picks up Buzz, bringing him straight to her mouth. A Girl dips Jessie’s hair in paint and uses her as a brus A Boy runs across the room, with Bullseye on top of a Cor Popper toy. Bullseye slides off, gets caught in its wheel Hamm is bathed in glue... Then coated in green glitter. A Girl “rides” Rex, snapping his tail off. The Aliens are squashed as a Boy sits on them. A Boy picks up Mr. Potato Head’s eye, shoves it up his no A Girl uses Buzz to hammer a square peg into a round hole BUZZ POV -- Buzz smashes the peg. Bam, Bam, Bam! A Boy runs by, tugs the Girl’s hair. She screams, tosses Buzz away. He lands on the window sill. BUZZ POV -- Across the playgound, in the Butterfly Room, class of Four- and Five-Year-Olds play lovingly with Lots and the other toys. Buzz frowns -- Why is it Heaven in there and Hell in here Abruptly, a HAND grabs him, pulls him back into the fray.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (voicebox) There’s a snake in my boot!  47

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON -- Woody. His string is pulled again.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (voicebox) I'd like to join your posse, boys, but first I’m gonna sing a little song. Bonnie holds Woody, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: A sheriff..!! Move over, Mr. Pricklepants! We have a guest! She plunks Woody at a small table circled by other toys - a HEDGEHOG, a UNICORN, and a TRICERATOPS.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want some coffee? She sets out cups, pretends to pour.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s good for you! But don’t drink too much or you'll hafta... Hafta... She dances from foot to foot.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Be right back...! She runs out the door. Woody comes alive, looks around. The other Toys stay frozen.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Psst! Hey! Hello! Hi -- Excuse me! The Hedgehog, MR. PRICKLEPANTS, comes alive briefly.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRICKLEPANTS
dialogues.text: Shhh!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Can you tell me where I am?

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRICKLEPANTS
dialogues.text: Shhhhhh!!!

dialogues.speaker: UNICORN
dialogues.text: The guy’s just askin’ a question!  48

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRICKLEPANTS
dialogues.text: Well, excuse me, I’m trying to stay in character! He freezes again. The Unicorn, friendly, turns to Woody.

dialogues.speaker: UNICORN
dialogues.text: My name’s Buttercup.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRICKLEPANTS
dialogues.text: Shhhh!!!!

dialogues.speaker: TRICERATOPS
dialogues.text: I’m Trixie!

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRICKLEPANTS
dialogues.text: Shhhhh!!!!

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Shhhhhh!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: BOTH
dialogues.text: Shhhhhhhhhh!!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Guys, hey! I don’t know where I am!

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: We’re either in a cafe in Paris, or a coffee shop in New Jersey. I’m pretty sure I just came back from the doctor with life-changing news! Woody is baffled.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERCUP
dialogues.text: We do a lot of improv here. Just stay loose, have fun, you'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No, no, no, I... A FLUSH. Woody gets back in his pose. Bonnie runs in.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Who wants lunch? Beep! Boop! Beep! She pushes buttons on a toy microwave oven, opens the doo removes a plastic hamburger, plunks it in front of Woody.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It has a secret ingredient... She lifts the top bun...  49

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...Jellybeans! Bonnie eats a jellybean, pulls Woody’s string.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (voicebox) Somebody's poisoned the water hole!

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Poison?! She spits the jellybean -- it sticks to Pricklepants’s he

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who would do such a mean thing?! She GASPS and becomes a different character.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (as Witch) Hee-hee-hee-hee-hee! ! She turns. SMASH ZOOM to a DOLL on the shelf behind her.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The scary witch!! Bonnie picks up the Doll, flies it around the room.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look out! She’s using her witch powers! CLOSE ON -- Woody.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (AS WOODY)
dialogues.text: I know where to hide! INT. BONNIE’S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER The toy box at the foot of Bonnie’s bed. It creaks open. Bonnie peeks out, grabs a Totoro, pulls it closed again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonnie and Woody huddle in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: She’1l never find us in here! Bonnie surreptitiously lifts the Doll into view.  50

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s wrong...? She turns. Sees the doll, SCREAMS. INT. BONNIE’S BEDROOM - DAY The toy box tips over, spilling Bonnie and her Toys.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: She found us! We need a spaceship to get away! She runs off into a closet. The Toys come alive.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: You're doin’ great!

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRICKLEPANTS
dialogues.text: Are you classically trained?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Look, I just need to know how to get outta here...!

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERCUP
dialogues.text: There IS NO WAY OUT!!! Woody is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just kidding. Door’s right over there. The Doll gets up, greets Woody.

dialogues.speaker: DOLL
dialogues.text: Well, Cowboy, you just jumped right in, didn't ya? I’m Dolly.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: ..-Uh, Woody. They shake.

dialogues.speaker: DOLLY
dialogues.text: “Woody”? Really? You’re gonna stick with that? ‘Cuz now’s your chance to change it -- new room and all. That's coming from a doll named “Dolly”. A PEA POD TOY zips open behind Woody. He turns.  51

dialogues.speaker: PEA
dialogues.text: Who’s the new guy?

dialogues.speaker: PEA
dialogues.text: Are you a real cowboy?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Well, actually, I....

dialogues.speaker: PEA
dialogues.text: ‘Course he’s not, pea-brain! He don’t even have a hat!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I do too have a... My hat?!

dialogues.speaker: PEA
dialogues.text: Told ‘ya!

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I found the spaceship!!

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRICKLEPANTS
dialogues.text: Show time! Woody and the Toys go lifeless as Bonnie runs out of the closet with makeshift shoebox rocket.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (AS WOODY)
dialogues.text: Quick! Fasten your seatbelts! Close your tray tables! She stuffs the toys in the box, drops it on a bedsheet. BONNIE (CONT’D) Hold on, it might get a little bumpy!
She pulls the sheet taut. The Toys fly into the air. SLOW MOTION -- Woody soaring. The moment is magical. Woody and the others tumble onto the bed. Bonnie flops down with them, hugging them close.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeee-haaaaw!!! You saved us, cowboy! You're our hero!!! She pulls Woody to her cheek -- just like Andy once did. Woody glances at the other Toys. They smile at him. He smiles back. That was great.  52

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Toys come to life, groaning.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Oh, I’ve got a kink in my slink. Rex staggers by, tail missing.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: My tail...! Where’s my tail?! Buzz sits up, dazed. Hamm pulls his cork. Detritus spills out. He strains. POP -- a Weeble pops out. Hamm picks up a plastic arm.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Someone need a hand? He tosses it to Mr. and Mrs. Potato Head -- their parts completely jumbled.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Where’s my nose... Here’s Here it is... Gimme that, your arm... Honey, the that’s mine... moustache...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz straightens up -- back CRACKING.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I don’t recall play time being quite that strenuous. Rex pulls his tail from a peg board.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Andy never played with us like that! Jessie peels a decal off Bullseye’s nose.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: We have to make the best of it.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: But these toddlers! They don’t know how to play with us!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: They’re too young!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: They're sticky!  53

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: We should be in the Butterfly Room! With the big kids!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD HAMM
dialogues.text: That’s right! You said it!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: We'll get this straightened out -- I‘1l go talk to Lotso about moving us to the other room. He clambers up a table, leaps to the bathroom door knob. It doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Blast. Try that one! Jessie leaps to the hallway door latch.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: It’s locked! At the playground door, Slinky tests the door knob.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Same here! Buzz drops down, points.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Try the windows. Hamm, on the sill, examines a window lock.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Eh, negatory. It’s a Fenster- Schneckler 380. Finest childproof lock in the world.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: We're trapped!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Wait! Did anyone notice the transom?

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: What’s a transom, Buzz? Buzz looks up -- atop the hallway door is an open transom

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Oh, great! How do we get up there?! Buzz narrows his eyes, thinking.  54

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Toys hold a Fisher Price Corn Popper. Buzz, a loop of red yarn wrapped across his chest, stands at the rear.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: All right, everyone! On three! One... Two...

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Three!!! They take off, pushing the popper at top speed.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let go! The Toys drop away, leaving Buzz to jump onto the handle. The popper strikes an upturned table, lofting Buzz in the air. He grabs a string that runs across the room, using i like a zip-line. As he reaches the end, Buzz leaps off, expands his wings and flies towards a display of hanging paper-mache caterpillars, using their legs to swing from one to another. On the ground, Hamm makes signal.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Jump! Bullseye and Rex jump off a shelf, catapulting a broom forward. Buzz bounces off the broom, towards the transom. He flips, twists, and lands -- safe. The Toys rejoice.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: He did it!!!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Way to go, Buzz! Buzz casts part of his yarn down to the Toys. They run an grab it. Buzz turns to the hallway, stops. BUZZ POV -- In the hall below, a pair of tough Day Care Toys, TWITCH (Bug Man) and CHUNK (Rock Man) saunter past.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNK
dialogues.text: You think they had a fun playtime?

dialogues.speaker: TWITCH
dialogues.text: Shhh...!!! They might hear you! Buzz frowns. O.S. GIGGLING. Buzz turns. Down the hall, Ken and Barbie say goodbye at the Butterfly Room door.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Okay, now you start.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: ..-love...

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: -.-you.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: See?! That time I said “love”. Okay, now, me first. Buzz. He stifles a dry heave.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, okay....!

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: ..-love...

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: »..-you! See what I mean? It changes every time!

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: You are so smart! As the Tough Toys pass, they drag Ken away.

dialogues.speaker: TWITCH
dialogues.text: C’mon, Romeo... We’re late.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: I‘1l wait up for you!

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Kisses...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz -- using the red yarn -- rappels down into the hall. He unties the yarn and steals off down the hallway. He reaches the Teacher's Lounge, approaches cautiously.  56 INT. TEACHERS’ LOUNGE - NIGHT Buzz peeks in. Ken, Twitch and Chunk approach a vending machine. Ken opens the bottom flap and they all go inside Buzz frowns. He walks to the vending machine. Suddenly -- strangely -- a cow MOOOOS. Buzz looks around, confused. Then he looks up. Silhouetted in the top of a glowing vending machine are K and the rest of his Gang. A Rooster crows: COCKADOODLE- DOO!! This is followed by MUFFLED LAUGHS and HUBBUB. Buzz approaches the machine. From inside come VOICES. GANG (0.S. Yeah, all right! Let’s go again! Buzz pushes open the dispenser flap, climbs in. Above him a pig OINKS loudly. More LAUGHS and GRIPES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz climbs up rows of candy bars and potato chips. He gets to the top, sneaks towards the light. In the top of the vending machine, a Gang of toys sits around a table.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: All right, place yer bets! Any splits? Here we go! The Gang throws batteries, Monopoly money, other items in a pot. Stretch the Octopus pulls the cord on a Farmer Say toy. As the arrow spins, the Gang roots for their bets.

dialogues.speaker: GANG
dialogues.text: C’mon, Duckie, Duckie! Big Pig! Big Pig...! Turkey! Gimme the Turkey!! Ken waves his hand over the table.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: All right. No more bets. The spinning arrow stops on “Duck”.

dialogues.speaker: FARMER SAYS TOY
dialogues.text: Here is a duck: “Quack, quack”.

dialogues.speaker: STRETCH
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes! Come to Mama! Stretch scoops up the pile of money. The others GROAN.  57

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Stretch takes the round. The game continues, Ken presiding.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Okay, minimum bet, five Monopoly. Coyotes wild. Changing two double AA's. (as he changes money: ) Hey, what do you guys think of the new recruits? Any Keepers?

dialogues.speaker: SPARKS
dialogues.text: Nah, disposable...!

dialogues.speaker: STRETCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Landfill!

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Cowgirl...? Dinosaur...?

dialogues.speaker: TWITCH
dialogues.text: Toddler fodder! They start placing bets again.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: How ‘bout that Spaceguy? He could be useful. Buzz reacts, listening.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNK
dialogues.text: He ain’t the sharpest knife in the... place where they keep the knives.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKS
dialogues.text: Neither are you, Chunk. LAUGHS. Twitch teases Ken.

dialogues.speaker: TWITCH
dialogues.text: You got a little Keeper yourself, didn’t’cha, Ken?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Hey! Lay off, Twitch! Barbie's different!

dialogues.speaker: STRETCH
dialogues.text: Mr. Softy over here...!

dialogues.speaker: CHUNK
dialogues.text: Whaddaya expect from a girls toy?  58 Ken stands, furious.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: I’m not a girls toy! I’m not! Why do you guys keep saying that?!!! Twitch waves a hand.

dialogues.speaker: TWITCH
dialogues.text: All them Toys are disposable. We'll be lucky if they last us a week! Buzz reacts. He turns to go... And bumps into Big Baby. Big Baby tosses Buzz on the table. The Gang quickly grabs and subdues him. Ken smirks.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Well, well, looky who we have here.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Stop! Let me go! He struggles. Ken narrows his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Take him to “The Library”.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Nooooooo! A sock puppet is pulled over Buzz’s head.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BONNIE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Bonnie sleeps -- toys tucked next to her. Woody carefully slips from under the covers. Bonnie stirs, moves her arm. Woody freezes, leg in the air. She settles back to sleep. Woody tiptoes across the bed, looks around the room. ZOOM IN -- Bonnie’s backpack, hanging from her door handl Woody pushes a chair to the door, climbs up, lifts a cape The address on the backpack is revealed -- 1225 Sycamore.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: 1225 Sycamore!

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRICKLEPANTS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Woody...! What’re you doing?  59 Woody turns. Bonnie’s Toys are watching from the bed.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I... I gotta get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: You're leaving?!

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERCUP
dialogues.text: Didn’t you have fun today?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Of course I did! More ‘n I’ve had in years, but... Y’see, I belong to someone else... He holds up his boot, where “ANDY” is written.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERCUP
dialogues.text: Who's “Yid-nah”?

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRICKLEPANTS
dialogues.text: I believe it’s pronounced “Yid-nay”.

dialogues.speaker: DOLLY
dialogues.text: Guys -- it says “Andy”!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: He’s my Bonnie...! And he’s leaving soon. I gotta get home!

dialogues.speaker: PEA POD
dialogues.text: Where’s home?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Elm Street. 234 Elm. (thinking) You guys have a map?

dialogues.speaker: DOLLY
dialogues.text: We're on it, Cowboy. Trixie...? Trixie giggles.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: I‘ll fire up the computer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sock is pulled off Buzz’s head. He’s tied to a toy chair in a closet lit with an overhead bulb. In shadows, Lotso’s Henchmen lurk. Buzz struggles to free himself.  60

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Unhand me, you cowards! I demand to talk to Lotso!

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Zip it, Buck Rogers! You don’t talk to Lotso ‘til we say you can... Abruptly, the door opens. Lotso stands, astonished.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Ken...?! What’s going on here?! Why’s this Toy tied up?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: He... He got out, Lotso!

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Got out? Oh, no, no, no! This isn’t how we treat our guests! Lotso approaches Buzz, begins untying him.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: F.A.O. my Schwartz...! There you go. I’m so sorry. He frees Buzz. Buzz stands, casting a dark look at Ken.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Lotso, there’s been a mistake.
