dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: A mistake...?!!!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: The children in the Caterpillar Room are not age-appropriate for me and my friends. We respectfully request a transfer to the Butterfly Room.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: (gestures grandly) Well, request granted!

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: But, Lotso...

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Hush now, Kenneth! This Toy’s shown initiative! Leadership! Why, I'd say we found ourselves a Keeper! (to others) Hear that, everyone?! We got a Keeper!  61 Lotso lifts Buzz’s arm -- World Champion! His Gang applauds dutifully. Lotso throws his arm around Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're callin’ you up to the Big Leagues, son! From now on, you'll have anything you want!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Excellent! I'’11 go get my friends. Lotso stops.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa! Hold on there, Boss! Those Caterpillar kids need someone to play with...!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: But my friends don’t belong there!

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Oh, none of us do! I agree! Which is why -- for the good of our community -- we ask the newer toys, the stronger ones, to take on the hardships the rest of us can’t bear anymore. Buzz frowns.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Well, I... I guess that makes sense. Lotso smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: But I can’t accept. We’re a family. We stay together. Lotso’s smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Family man, eh? I understand. (sharply) Put him back in the “Time Out” chair. Big Baby grabs Buzz and slams him into the toy chair.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: What are you...? What?! Unhand me!

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Bring in The Bookworm.  62 Ken whistles. A RUSTLING from a shelf above, where rows o files are cluttered.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKWORM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hold on... Here it is! An aged Toy -- The Bookworm -- pushes aside files.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKWORM
dialogues.text: It was filed under “Lightyear”. He tosses a small booklet down to Lotso. Lotso opens the booklet, flips through it. Buzz looks close, reacts -- it’s a Buzz Lightyear Instruction Manual.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Let’s see here... Accessories... Maintenance... Oh, here we go! (reading) “Remove screws to access battery compartment...” Big Baby pushes Buzz down, holding him while Sparks opens Buzz’s battery compartment. Screws drop to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! Let go of me!

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: (reading) “To return your Buzz Lightyear Action Figure to its original factory settings, slide the switch from PLAY to DEMO...” Lotso looks up, nods. Twitch looks -- inside the panel is a MODE switch. He reaches for it. Buzz struggles.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Stop! No...! No...!!!  NOOOOO!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Toys sit near the door. The echo of Buzz’s scream is heard. They turn.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Sounds like it came from the hall!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: I’1l see what it was!  63 She marches to the door and plucks out her remaining eye. She holds it under the door, sweeping it back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Potato Head’s Eye, held by her hand, looks up and do the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Toys gather around her.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Whaddaya see? Anything...? POV, PANNING -- The hall is dark and empty. Suddenly, a VISION of Andy in his room FADES IN over the dark hallway

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Nah, just a dark hallway and... Wait, wait...! I see Andy! The other Toys look at each other, disbelieving.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: That's impossible...!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: No, I really see him! In his room! (realizing) My other eye! The one I left behind! She concentrates fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSITION TO
dialogues.text: INT. ANDY’S ROOM - NIGHT - POV From under the bed, we SEE college boxes piled up by the open door. Andy crosses frame, carrying another box.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD, (V.0O)
dialogues.text: This is so weird...! He’s packing up... Uh-oh. Oh, here comes Buster. Buster sniffs under the bed, right toward her eye.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Outta the way! Get away!  64 Buster yawns, turns, and walks out of FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, Andy’s in the hall. He’s looking in the attic. Wait, there’s Mom. Why is he so upset? Andy gestures -- I left the Toys right here! Mom shrugs. Andy picks up a trash bag. Then Andy’s Mom remembers -- her hands fly to her face. Andy slaps his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh, no! Oh, this is terrible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Potato Head puts her eye back in, looks at the other

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: He’s looking for us! Andy’s looking for us!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: He’s looking for us?!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: So, Andy does want us! I knew it! I just knew it!!! Rex picks up an Alien, does a happy dance.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: I think he did mean to put us in the attic!

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Well, then Woody was telling the truth!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Holy cow!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: And you didn’t believe him!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Hey, you didn’t believe him first! Jessie stands -- fire in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Guys, we gotta... We gotta go home!  65 CREAK -- A door opens. Light spills in. The Toys turn. Lotso saunters in with his Gang.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Lotso...!

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: How're y’all doin’ this fine evening?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Oh, thank heavens! Jessie rushes to him. The others follow.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you seen Buzz?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: There’s been a mistake! We have to go!

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Go?! Why, you just got here! In the nick of time, too! We were runnin’ low on volunteers for the Little Ones! They just love new Toys, now don’t they?

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Love?! We've been chewed! Kicked! Drooled on!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Just look at my pocketbook! She holds up her chewed purse. Lotso bends down, amused.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Well, here’s the thing, Sweet Potato -- you ain’t leavin’ Sunnyside.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Sweet Potato?! Who do you think you're talking to? I have over thirty accessories and I deserve more respec-- Abruptly, Lotso yanks her mouth off. Everyone is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Abh...! That’s better! Lotso’s Henchmen snicker.  66

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Hey! No one takes my wife’s mouth!!! Except me! Give it back, you furry air freshener! He steps up to retrieve the mouth. Lotso holds it above him. He finally grabs it. Jessie heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: C’mon, guys -- we’re going home.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Whoa, Missy! You’re not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: (over her shoulder) Oh, yeah? And who’s gonna stop us? Jessie almost collides with a blank-faced Buzz, stepping from the shadows. Jessie and the others are thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Buzz! You're back! He runs -- arms open -- to greet him. Buzz makes a Kung-F sound, strikes a pose.

dialogues.speaker: REX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Buzz...? WHAM!!! Buzz tackles Rex, slamming him to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Hey! Buzz leaps and kicks, spins the Toys around, and knocks their legs from under them.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Buzz! The Toys fall to the floor, stunned. Buzz stands atop them, salutes.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Prisoners disabled, Commander Lotso!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Buzz? What are you doing...?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Silence, minions of Zurg! You’re in the custody of the Galactic Alliance!  67

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Zurg...?

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Galactic Alliance...?

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Huh-boy...!

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Good work, Lightyear. Now lock ‘em up!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Yes, sir! JUMP CUTS -- Buzz and Lotso’s Gang herd the Toys into the room’s wire-mesh cubbies. Jessie fights back -- taking out Chunk and Sparks. Stretc grabs her from behind, puts her in a wire cubby, shuts it

dialogues.speaker: STRETCH
dialogues.text: Where do you think you’re going?! Jessie reaches through the cubby wire to Buzz’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Buzz...?! We’re your friends! He swats her hand away.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Spare me your lies, Temptress! Your Emperor is defeated. And I’m immune to your... Bewitching good looks. He turns, ramrod straight, and walks off. Big Baby lifts Mrs. Potato Head to a cubby. Mr. Potato Head intercedes.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Hey, Mongo! Keep your paws off my wife! Big Baby drops Mrs. Potato Head in the cubby, turns and picks up Mr. Potato Head.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you doing? Let go of me you drooling doofus! Lotso steps in.  68

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Wait! I think this Potato needs to learn himself some manners! Take him to The Box. Big Baby hoists Potato Head up and toddles off.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Where’re you taking me? Put me down, you moron! Bad baby! Bad baby!!! They toddle past Barbie as she enters the room, confused.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Ken...?! What’s going on?!

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Barbie...! I told you to wait in the Dream House! Ken puts an arm around her, leading her out.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: What’re you doing to my friends? Barbie looks over her shoulder as Sparks the Robot tosses an Alien into a cubby. Twitch slams it shut.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hmmph ! She slaps Ken’s arm away and turns to join the Toys in solidarity. Ken tries to grab her.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Wait, Barbie!

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Don’t touch me! We’re through! She stalks off. Ken is devastated. Then Barbie turns, walks back to him. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And gimme my scarf back! She yanks the ascot off his neck.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Oww! Barbie is slammed into a cubby. Lotso surveys the room.  69

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Lightyear! Explain our overnight accommodations.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Yes, sir! Buzz strides past the Toys, each trapped in a cubby.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Prisoners sleep in their cells! Any Prisoner caught outside their cell spends the night in The Box!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Potato Head is carried to a covered sandbox. Big Baby lifts the sandbox cover, tosses Potato Head in. Potato Head reaches out, begging for mercy...

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Roll call at dusk and dawn! Any Prisoner misses roll call spends the night in The Box! ...Big Baby lowers the lid, closing into BLACKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz rattles off the rules. Jessie grows impatient.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Prisoners do not speak unless spoken to! Any Prisoner talks back spends the night...

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: .-..-In The Box. We get it. Buzz whips around. Lotso puts a calming hand on him.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: At ease, soldier! They're neutralized! But remember: They'll say anything to make you doubt yourself!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, Commander! Any doubt I had got pounded out of me at the Academy! Lotso climbs on a podium of ABC blocks -- jovial, relaxed  70

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Listen up, folks! We got a way of doing things here at Sunnyside! If you start at the bottom, pay your dues... Life here can be a dream come true! But if you break our rules, step outta line, try to check out early? Well... You’re just hurtin’ yourselves. He takes out Woody’s hat, tosses it. It slides across the floor to Jessie’s cubby. The Toys gasp in horror.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Woody...! (to Lotso) What’d you do to him?! Lotso sits back in his truck bed, taps his cane.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Y’all get a good night’s rest! You got a full day of play time tomorrow. Lotso chuckles as he and his cronies drive off. Buzz remains behind, standing guard over the “cell block”. The Toys grasp the bars of their cubbies -- the horrible truth of their situation hitting home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON -- A computer keyboard. Woody types an address.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: 1-2-2-5... Sy--ca--more... BLOOP -- Suddenly, an IM WINDOW pops up on the SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who's “VelociSTAR237"? Trixie pushes in.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Oh...! That’s just a dinosaur toy down the street. That’s nothing. Lemme just take care of that! (beat) Just a dinosaur...! Woody finishes typing.  71

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: All right. Sy--ca--more... Okay, “Enter”! Trixie hits the Return. Slowly, a map begins to assemble.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please don’t be far! Please! The map resolves itself. The route to Andy’s house is a short “Z” -- less than two blocks away. Woody is amazed.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right around the corner...?! It’s right around the corner!!! Ecstatic, he hugs Bonnie’s toys, leaps off the desk, does happy dance across the floor, strides to the kitchen door

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m going to college! Look at me, I'm big toy on campus! Hello! Hey! I‘1ll see you at the Sock Hop!

dialogues.speaker: DOLLY
dialogues.text: Okay, Potsie! Woody starts to slip through a pet door.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, listen -- if any of you guys ever get to Sunnyside Day Care? You tell ‘em Woody made it home! Bonnie’s Toys gasp.

dialogues.speaker: DOLLY
dialogues.text: You came from Sunnyside?!

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: But... How’d you escape?!!!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: It wasn’t easy, I... What do you mean “escape”? Bonnie's Toys trade glances. Pricklepants steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRICKLEPANTS
dialogues.text: Sunnyside is a place of ruin and despair, ruled by an evil bear who smells of strawberries!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Lotso...?!  72

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERCUP
dialogues.text: He may seem plush and huggable on the outside. But inside, he’s a monster!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: But... How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRICKLEPANTS
dialogues.text: Chuckles... He’1ll tell you! They turn -- with awe and respect -- to a toy clown, Chuckles, sitting on a sill, staring grimly out the windo Woody steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCKLES
dialogues.text: Yeah, I knew Lotso. He was a good toy. A friend. Me and him, we had the same kid -- Daisy... INT. DAISY’S LIVING ROOM - DAY - FLASHBACK A freckle-faced five-year-old, DAISY, unwraps a gift unde a Christmas tree and finds a fresh, smiling Lotso inside.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCKLES, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I was there when Lotso got unwrapped. She hugs him -- love at first sight.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCKLES, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Daisy loved us all, but Lotso... Lotso was special. INT. DAISY’S HOUSE - DAY - FLASHBACKS QUICK CUTS: Daisy takes Lotso everywhere -- jumping throu a lawn sprinkler; pushed on a swing; in bed while she rea to him, etc. He gazes lovingly at her.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCKLES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They did everything together. You never seen a kid and a toy more in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy sits in the back of a station wagon, Lotso in her lap. Big Baby and Chuckles are buckled in beside them.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCKLES, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: One day, we took a drive...  73

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a rest stop, Daisy’s Family has lunch in the grass whi Daisy plays happily with Lotso, Chuckles, and Big Baby.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCKLES, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hit a rest stop, had a little play time. Daisy’s Mom waves a sandwich. Daisy puts down the Toys an runs to join her family.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: A sleeping Daisy is carried to the car.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCKLES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: After lunch, Daisy fell asleep. A seat belt is clicked around the sleeping Daisy. The car drives off. Daisy’s Toys sit up, their worst fears come true.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVES
dialogues.text: Lotso peers down the road, keeping vigil as the sun sets. Days pass. Rain falls. The forgotten Toys remain.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCKLES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She never came back. CLOSE -- A heart-shaped pendant reads, “My heart belongs to...” A child's writing shows Daisy’s name and address. Lotso reads the pendant, hung around Big Baby’s neck. He sets off across the fields. Chuckles and Big Baby follow.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCKLES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Lotso wouldn't give up. It took forever, but we finally made it back to Daisy’s. EXT. DAISY’S HOUSE - DUSK Lotso, Chuckles and Big Baby stand in the bushes outside Daisy’s window -- muddy, worn. Big Baby boosts Lotso and Chuckles to the window sill. They peer in. Through the window, Daisy lies in her bed, reading a picture book.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCKLES, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But by then, it was too late. FAST ZOOM -- Tucked beside her is a brand-new Lotso Bear.  74 TRACK IN ON -- Lotso. His Universe is shattered. Lotso drops from the window. Rain begins to fall.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCKLES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Something changed that day inside Lotso. Something snapped... Lotso’s face hardens. Big Baby stares -- uncomprehending.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: She replaced us. C’mon! He turns to go, but Big Baby and Chuckles stay put.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG CHUCKLES
dialogues.text: No, she only replaced yo--! Lotso turns on Chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: She replaced all of us! Didn’t she?! Chuckles shrinks back, cowed. Big Baby looks at the pendant, turns and begins climbing up towards Daisy's window. Lotso walks back to Big Baby and yanks him down.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She don’t love you no more! Now come on! He rips the pendant off, throws it away, and stalks off. Chuckles and Big Baby are left behind -- heart-broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lotso, Chuckles, and Big Baby hunch in the red, tail-lit glow of the bumper of a delivery truck as it drives throu swirling rain. Their eyes are dead, hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCKLES, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We were lost. Cast off. Unloved. Unwanted... The truck hits a pothole, knocking them off the bumper. They hit the pavement, tumble into a puddle in front of..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s dark. Rain pours. Lotso, Chuckles, and the Baby lift their faces from the puddle. A FLASH of lightning reveals the Sunnyside Day Care Cente  75

dialogues.speaker: CHUCKLES
dialogues.text: Then we found Sunnyside. But Lotso wasn’t my friend anymore... Lotso stands, eyes narrowed. He limps towards the Day Care. Chuckles and Big Baby watch from the puddle. Lightning FLASHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckles, remembering. Woody listens, rapt.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCKLES
dialogues.text: ...-He wasn’t anyone’s friend. He took over Sunnyside, rigged the whole system. He reaches in his pocket, pulls out Big Baby’s pendant.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: So... How’d you get out?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCKLES
dialogues.text: I got broke. Bonnie found me, took me home. Other Toys, they weren’t so lucky. (voice quavers) It ain’t right, what Lotso done! New toys -- they don’t stand a chance! Woody looks up.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: But... My friends are in there!

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERCUP
dialogues.text: You can’t go back! It’s too dangerous!

dialogues.speaker: MR. PRICKLEPANTS
dialogues.text: Returning now would be suicide!

dialogues.speaker: DOLLY
dialogues.text: But what about your... “Andy”?

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Isn't he leaving tomorrow? TRACK IN ON -- Woody, torn.  76

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is still. A HARMONICA plays mournfully. TRACK down the cubbies -- The Toys grip the bars, forlorn CRANE TO REVEAL Hamm, playing the harmonica. Suddenly, Buzz pounds on Hamm’s cubby.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Quiet, musical hog! Knock it off! Hamm stops playing, sighs. Buzz moves off. Bullseye looks at Woody's hat, whimpers sadly. Jessie pats his muzzle.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Oh, Bullseye... I miss Woody, too. She turns away, bows her head.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But he ain’t ever comin’ back. Jessie lifts her boot, revealing “ANDY” written underneat Her eyes fill with regret. The bathroom door bursts open. A Tonka truck races in the room -- Lotso in the back, his Gang hanging off the sides WHOOPING it up. The truck comes screeching to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Rise and shine, Campers! Buzz snaps to attention, salutes.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Commander Lotso, Sir! All quiet! Nothing to report!

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Excellent, Lightyear! C’mon -- we need you back at Star Command! Buzz hops in the back of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Wait! What you have you done with my husband?!

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Big Baby...? Big Baby steps forward and tosses a dazed Mr. Potato Head into the room -- coughing, groaning, covered in sand.  77 The Toys gasp. Mrs. Potato Head reaches out.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Sweetheart...!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: It was cold...! And dark...! Nothing but sand and a couple of Lincoln Logs...

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: I don’t think those weren’t Lincoln Logs. Lotso addresses the room.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Y'all get ready -- you got a play- date with destiny!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A BELL -- Ringing. Bonnie runs down the hall and enters the Butterfly Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room thrums with the happy CHATTER of young kids. Bonnie drops off her backpack at the lockers, rushes off. STAY on her backpack. It unzips. Woody peers out, then surreptitiously scrambles to the top of a bookshelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody pushes aside an acoustic panel, climbs in the crawl space above the tiles, and slides the panel back in place O.S. -- Children’s SHRIEKS. Woody turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crawling, Woody follows the noise, puts his ear to a tile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody pulls up the ceiling tile and drops onto an empty reading loft, furnished with pillows and bean bag chairs. He creeps to the edge of the loft and scans the room.  78 POV -- Below, a Toddler uses Rex to hammer a bongo drum. Another Toddler holds a Potato Head in each hand, then smashes them to the ground. Their pieces scatter. A child swings Jessie by her hair, releases her. Jessie slams into a wall, drops to the floor. Woody is horrified. Then, off-screen, a toy-phone bell RINGS. Woody turns. A Fisher Price Phone, The Lifer, wheels into view. He RINGS again, drops his receiver, retreats into shadows. Woody creeps to the phone, lifts the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Uh... Hello...? The Lifer’s voice is hoarse and grizzled.

dialogues.speaker: LIFER
dialogues.text: You shouldn’a come back, Cowboy. They cracked down hard since you left. More guards. More patrols. You and your friends ain’t ever gettin’ outta here now.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I made it out once...

dialogues.speaker: LIFER
dialogues.text: You got lucky once. Want my advice? Keep your heads down. You’1ll survive.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Yeah? For how long?

dialogues.speaker: LIFER
dialogues.text: (squints like Clint) I been here years. They’ll never break me. There’s only one way Toys leave this place... The Lifer rolls forward. Through the window, the Janitor across the yard -- dumps the broken Toy Train into a tras chute. Woody shudders -- he’s just witnessed a Toy death.

dialogues.speaker: LIFER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Poor fella. Trash truck comes at dawn. Then it’s off to The Dump... Woody bends down, respectful.  719

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I appreciate your concern, Old Timer. But we have a kid waiting for us. Now we're leaving. If you’d help us -- one toy to another -- I’d sure be grateful. The Lifer sighs.

dialogues.speaker: LIFER
dialogues.text: Well, if you’re gonna get out... First thing you gotta get through’s the doors. SHOTS -- FAST TRACKING IN on knobs of the playground door the hall door; the office door. Each door is shut and locked. Keys are left dangling on a hook in the office.

dialogues.speaker: LIFER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..-Locked every night, inside and out. Keys are left on a hook in the office.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Got it. What else? SHOTS -- Night. Toy Trucks patrol the empty halls of the Day Care. Outside, Trucks patrol the deserted playground.

dialogues.speaker: LIFER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Lotso has trucks patrolling all night long. Hallway. Lobby. Playground.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah... What about the wall? SHOTS -- TRACKING along the mural-covered cinder block wa

dialogues.speaker: LIFER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Eight feet high. Cinderblock. No way through it. You go over or under. Woody frowns.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: That’s it?! Doesn’t seem so bad.

dialogues.speaker: LIFER
dialogues.text: It’s not. Your real problem’s The Monkey.  80

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TOY CHIMP sits at the console of security monitors.

dialogues.speaker: LIFER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Monkey's the Eye in the Sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bank of monitors is reflected in them.

dialogues.speaker: LIFER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He sees everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Toy Bunny slips through the bars of his cubby, scampers toward the hallway door.

dialogues.speaker: LIFER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...Classrooms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Monkey, staring at the security monitors, sees the Bunny on screen, bares his teeth and SCREECHES, presses t PA button, and begins furiously banging his cymbals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bunny -- busted -- freezes and looks around in a pani The hall door opens and Lotso and his Gang step in. Big Baby lurches toward the Bunny menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Patrol Truck passes down a dark hallway. A Toy Penguin, hidden, peeks out of a potted plant, jumps to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: LIFER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..-Hallways... He waddles for the front door. ZOOM UP to a security camera at the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Monkey sees the Penguin, hits the PA button, and begi SCREECHING and banging cymbals.  81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Penguin is surrounded by Patrol Trucks. He puts his wings up. Big Baby pushes his way through the trucks, intent on meting out prompt and thorough justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trio of Plushies use a dart gun to fire a dart, tied wi string, over the wall. They begin scaling the wall.

dialogues.speaker: LIFER
dialogues.text: ...Even the playground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Monkey sees the Plushies, SCREECHES his alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spotlight hits the Plushies. Within the spotlight rises the silhouette of Big Baby, arms lifted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lifer lays it on the line for Woody.

dialogues.speaker: LIFER
dialogues.text: You can unlock doors, sneak past guards, climb the wall... But if you don’t take out that Monkey, you ain’t goin’ nowhere. Y’wanna get outta here? Get ridda that Monkey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bell RINGS. The Toddlers -- playing rough -- look up.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Okay! Recess! She opens the playground door. The Toddlers drop the Toys rush outside. The Teacher hits the lights, closes the doo Jessie and the Toys sit up, groaning and aching.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Pssst...! Pssst...! Hey, guys...!  82 They look over. From a puppet theater, Woody waves.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Woody? Woody!!!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Woody!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Thank goodness! They quickly run and gather around him, rejoicing.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: You're alive!!!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Hey, Buddy!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: ‘Course I’m alive...! (sees Bullseye) Hey, my hat!!! Woody takes his hat from Bullseye, puts it on.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait. Where’s Buzz?

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Lotso did something to him!

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: He thinks he’s a Space Ranger again!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Oh yes. “Return of the Astro Nut!”

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Oh, Woody, we were wrong to leave Andy. I... I was wrong...

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Jessie's right, Woody -- she was wrong!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No, no. It’s my fault for leaving you guys. From now on, we stick together. The Toys smile, reassured.  83

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: But... Andy’s leavin’ for college!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: College!!! Hog-tie the mailman!!! We gotta get you home before Andy leaves tomorrow!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Tomorrow...? But, that means...

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: It means we’re busting outta here tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: What?! Impossible!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: But there’s no way outta here!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No, there is one way out. One way... He turns. RACK FOCUS -- Through the window is the trash chute on th maintenance shed. Woody turns to the Toys. They huddle.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, here’s the plan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken, dapper in an evening robe, conducts his nightly roll call. He’s trailed by Buzz. Big Baby stands guard.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Cowgirl...

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Horse... Bullseye WHINNIES.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Piggy bank...

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Yo.  84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From above, Woody watches through a ventilation grate.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Tyrannosaurus...

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Barbie...

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken strolls on.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Potato Head... Potato Head? Silence. Buzz backs up, looks in the cubby.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Hey! Tuberous Root Man! Wake up! Buzz rattles the bars. An actual potato rolls to the fron of the cubby -- a dummy potato, as it were.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Impossible! A NOISE. Ken and Buzz turn. Potato Head is at the window, struggling with the locks.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! Potato Head sees he’s been spotted. He jumps off the sill and sprints to the bathroom door. Buzz and Ken run across the room. Big Baby toddles after them. As they EXIT FRAME we TILT UP to find... Woody, in a hanging light, takes out a pipe cleaner, bend it, uses it to snag the clothing line of kids’ paintings. Potato Head reaches the bathroom, bangs on the door, then turns to face Buzz, Ken, and Big Baby. They surround him.  85

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Monkey, at the security console, sees Buzz and Ken corner Potato Head. He leans in to watch.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Little late for a stroll, eh, Potato Head?

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: That’s Mr. Potato Head to you, Smoothie! PAN and ZOOM past the distracted Monkey to another monito On it, Slinky slips out of his cubby cell.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You're turning out to be quite the trouble-maker, aren’t ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Ken and Buzz, Slinky runs to the middle of the roo

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: What’d you think you were gonna do? Waltz right outta here? Woody grabs a bag of marbles, grasps the clothesline, jum

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: And I would’a got away with it too, if it weren’t for you meddling Toys! Woody lowers via the clothesline, drops the bag of marble grabs Slinky, and ascends back up to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ya ascot-wearin’ pink-noser! Mr. Brains-Sold-Separately!!! He kicks Ken. Ken yelps, turns to Big Baby.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Take him back to The Box! Big Baby grabs Potato Head, lifts him off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: No! Not The Box! I’m sorry! I didn’t mean it! I like ascots! Really! No... No! Noooooo!!! They disappear through the bathroom door.  86

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody and Slinky watch as Potato Head is dragged off. The close the ceiling panel.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Okay, check...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken turns to Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Good work, Lightyear! Resume your, uh... Space-guy... Thing-y!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, Well-Groomed Man! He salutes, departs. Ken turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Ken...?! Ken...! Ken stops. Barbie waves to him. Ken looks around, then approaches warily. Barbie is tearful.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: I can’t take it here, Ken! I want to go to the Butterfly Room! With you!

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you should’a thought of that yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: I was wrong! I want to be with you, Ken! In your Dream House! Take me away from this! Take me away! She breaks down sobbing. Ken is torn. Finally, he gives in -- no match for a woman’s tears.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Darn it, Barbie...! He moves closer, speaks low.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, but, things are complicated around here. You gotta do what I say!  87

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: (tears of gratitude) I will, Ken! I promise! Satisfied -- and a little smug -- he pulls open the cubby

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Baby opens the lid of the Sand Box.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Wait! I’11 do anything...! I’11 change your diapers! Big Baby tosses Potato Head in, lowers the lid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Baby turns and walks off. STAY ON the sand box. TRACK IN to find a wood knot in the side of the box. It pops out, falls to the ground. Potato Head’s hand emerges, clutching his eye. It looks around. One by one, Mr. Potato Head’s parts fly out the hole and land on the ground, next to the sandbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Monkey sits motionless, staring maniacally at the security monitors. The only sound is a TICKING clock. Woody, clutching a pouch, drops into FRAME behind the Mon as Slinky, holding Woody’s ankles, lowers Woody head-firs Woody -- dangling -- begins swinging closer and closer to the Monkey. The Monkey frowns at a reflection in the monitor. The Monkey whips around, SCREECHING. Slinky slips. He and Woody land on the Monkey, knocking the mic to the ground. The Monkey HISSES, leaps off the desk, runs for the mic. Woody lunges for the Monkey, but misses. He grabs the microphone cord and whips it, tripping the Monkey. Woody grabs the Monkey. The Monkey flips himself on top o Woody and starts crashing his cymbals against Woody's hea  88

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Go... Get... The... Tape!!! Slinky runs to a Scotch tape dispenser, grabs the tape wi his teeth, heads back toward Woody. The Monkey turns, see Slinky charging, tape in his mouth. He SCREECHES.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO BLACK
dialogues.text: INT. KEN’S DREAM HOUSE, BUTTERFLY ROOM - NIGHT Ken and Barbie ride the Dream House elevator to the top floor. Ken opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: And this... Is where the magic happens. FAST PULL BACK to REVEAL the living room of his Dream House. Racks of clothes line the walls. Barbie gasps.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Look at all your clothes!!! I can’t believe you never brought me up here! Barbie flips through the racks. Ken joins her.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tennis whites! Mission to Mars!

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: I know, I know! Check this out -- “Kung-Fu Fighting”! “Campus Hero” with matching sports pennant, huh?!

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Flower Power...!!! Oh, Ken...! Ken pivots away, his mood turning to melancholy reflectio

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: No one appreciates clothes here, Barbie. (then, bitter: ) No one. Barbie walks up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Ken... Would you model a few outfits for me? Just a few? Ken is stunned -- no one’s ever asked this of him. Throbbing DISCO begins.  89

dialogues.speaker: QUICK CUTS
dialogues.text: Ken emerges from behind a screen, sporting some of the mo insane Ken outfits ever -- ‘90s, ‘80s, ‘70s, even 1960s - with matching accessories. Ken strikes just the right pose for each outfit -- slingi a jacket over his shoulder; doing “The Frug” in a fringe vest; polka-ing in Lederhosen; scuba moves; break dancing Barbie sits watching, enthralled. She laughs, claws her hand, growls like a cat. Finally, she applauds wildly. Ken grins -- exceptionally pleased with himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody and Slinky finish taping up the struggling Monkey. Slinky opens a desk drawer. Woody rolls the Monkey in. Slinky pushes it closed.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Go get the key! Woody runs to a bulletin board above the desk.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Where is it...? Where is it...? Where’s the key? He finds the keys, buried under push-pinned papers.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bingo! Slinky toggles a security camera joystick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessie sees the security camera panning back and forth. She turns, whispers.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Yodel-Lay-Hee-Hoooooo...!!! A few cubbies down, Hamm and Rex share a look. ANGLE -- Buzz, patrolling...

dialogues.speaker: HAMM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! Whadda you think you’re doin?! Buzz stops, turns.  90 In the cell, Hamm plugs his cork into his belly.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: I told you -- keep your hands off of my stuff! Rex raises his fists, trying to sound tough.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Make a move, Porky! Hamm jumps Rex. They grapple. Buzz runs over.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Hey! No fighting! Break it up! He pulls the “cell” from the cubby and they tumble out.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Take that, Walnut-Brain! No wonder you’re extinct! Jessie and Bullseye steal out of their cubbies while Buzz gets between Hamm and Rex, holding them apart.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Hey, you can’t hit each other! That’s my job!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Yoo-hoo! Buzz looks up. Jessie and Bullseye stand on a bookcase above him, holding an empty, clear plastic toy bin. They leap, slamming the bin over Buzz. Hamm and Rex leap on top of it, pinning it to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (muffled) Help! Prison riot! Buzz FIRES his laser in a circle at the side of the bin. He charges at the wall, hits it, and falls over. Jessie turns to Bullseye.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Get the tortilla! Bullseye heads to a locker, pulls out a lunch box. Jessie opens it. Inside is a tortilla. Jessie grabs it, dashes to the door, slides it under. She knocks and runs off.  91

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tortilla lays outside. From the shadows, one of Potat Head's arms appears, crawls over, grabs the tortilla, and drags it into the darkness. One by one, the parts implant themselves in the tortilla. The Tortilla stands unsteadil looks around, blinks, then heads off across the playgroun INT. KEN’S DREAM HOUSE, BUTTERFLY ROOM - NIGHT Ken -- headband on -- is behind a shoji screen.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Ready...! Ken leaps from behind the screen in a Karate Gi and does series of fighting moves, kicking and punching the air.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Haiii-Yaaa! Wah! Whaaa-aaa-aaa -- He freezes mid-pose. Barbie isn’t there.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh... Barbie? Barbie leaps out of nowhere, tackling Ken. Ken lands on his chest. Barbie grabs his head, spins it 180 degrees.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: No more games, Ken. What did Lotso do to Buzz, and how do we get him back? Ken is secretly thrilled to have Barbie straddling his chest, talking tough. He is defiant.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: You can’t make me talk! You can’t! Barbie glares at him, eyes narrowing. Ken -- unable to contain his excitement -- blurts out:

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-But I’d like to see you try!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Security truck patrols the hall. As it passes, the office door opens. Woody peers out.  92

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slinky is poised with a key attached to a rubber-band sli shot. Slinky pulls it back. Woody signals “Go!” Slinky releases the slingshot. It shoots the key under th door, across the hall and into the Caterpillar Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessie stops the key with her boot, picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Potato Head hoists himself up a tricycle and onto a classroom window ledge. He peers in. Inside the Butterfly Room, Lotso is asleep. Potato Head turns and uses the trike’s mirror to catch a moonbeam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Potato Head, on the sill by the door, sees the signa She uses the key to unlock the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Jessie, Bullseye, Mrs. Potato Head and th Aliens slip outside. As a SPOTLIGHT sweeps past, they duc behind a traffic cone then creep off across the playgroun INT. KEN’S DREAM HOUSE, BUTTERFLY ROOM - NIGHT Ken is tied to a paddle-ball paddle by the ball’s string. He glowers as Barbie browses through his racks of clothin

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Let's see -- Hawaiian surf trunks... She holds them up, then RIPS them apart. Ken is horrified

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Barbie, those were vintage! (steels himself) It's okay! Go ahead, rip ‘em! They're a dime a dozen!

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Oooohh! Glitter tux!  93 RIPPPP...! She tosses the shreds at him. Ken groans in torment, but remains defiant.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Who cares?! Who cares?! Sequins are tacky! Barbie picks up a Nehru jacket. Ken gasps in horror.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Oooohh!! A Nehru jacket!

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Barbie!!! Not the Nehru...!

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: This is from, what -- 1967?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: The Gruvvy Formal Collection, yes!

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: What a shame...

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Oh, no! No! No, no, no...!!! Barbie pulls at the seams. A stitch POPS. Ken cracks.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s an instruction manual! Lotso switched Buzz to Demo Mode...! He breaks down, sobbing. Barbie, steely, grabs Ken.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Where’s that manual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleepy Bookworm pulls the Buzz Lightyear Manual from hi stacks, hands it down to a waiting Figure in a SPACE SUIT

dialogues.speaker: BOOKWORM
dialogues.text: I don’t know why this can’t wait til morning, Ken, but... Here ya go! The Figure salutes, turns, walks off. The Bookworm turns away, then hears an odd CLICKING. He turns back, stares. POV -- The Space-Suited Figure is wearing pink high heels The Bookworm rolls his eyes -- Ken! -- and turns away.  94

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: What’s takin’ so doggone long? A KNOCK. Woody slides the ceiling panel, revealing Barbie in the Space Suit, helmet off.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: So how do we fix Buzz? Barbie grins, hoists up Buzz’s Instruction Manual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Potato Head, on the ledge, sees Barbie pulled up into the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody gives Potato Head the “thumbs up”. Potato Head responds with complicated baseball-catcher gestures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Potato Head turns and edges down the ledge. A FLUTTERING. He looks. His path is blocked by a Pigeon. A stare down.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: What’re you lookin’ at, Feathers? The pigeon pecks him, taking a chunk out of his tortilla.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! Ow! The pigeon pecks again. Potato Head slaps the pigeon. The pigeon grabs his forehead, dragging him down the ledge. Potato Head hits the pigeon with his hat, gives it a kick The pigeon flies off. Potato Head shakes his fist.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah, fly away, ya coward! The tortilla rips and disintegrates.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh-oh... In pieces, he drops off the ledge to the ground.  95

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, that’s just great! A section of tortilla props itself up, looks around. It spots the classroom vegetable garden. The eye goes wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz is still trapped in the bin, banging on the ceiling. Hamm and Rex have grown weary of his calls for help.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (muffled) Help! Prison riot!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Give it up. No one can hear you.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (looking up, muffled) What...?

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: I said no one can hear you!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (confused, muffled)

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: (yelling) He said, “No one can...!!!"

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Shhhh...!!! Will you be quiet?! He slaps a hand over Rex’s mouth. A NOISE. They look up. A ceiling tile opens. Woody, Slinky, and Barbie drop in.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Woody! You’re back! Rex and Hamm move to the front of the bin. Buzz runs to the back and jumps -- knocking Hamm and Rex off the bin. Buzz makes a break for it -- running across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Stop him! Don’t let him get out!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (into wrist radio) Star Command, I’ve been taken hostage by my own prisoners!!!  96 Hamm and Rex tackle Buzz. Hamm, Rex, Woody and Slink keep Buzz pinned down, as Barbie rushes over with the manual.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Quick, open his back! There’s a switch! They pull open Buzz’s compartment, revealing the switch. Woody flips it. Buzz struggles.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Unhand me, Zurg scum! The Galactic courts will show you no mercy! Woody flips the switch back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: It’s not working! Why’s it not working? Where’s the manual? Hamm flips through at top speed.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Here we go! There should be a little hole under the Switch!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Little hole. Got it!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: (reading) “To reset your Buzz Lightyear, insert paper clip....”

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Rex, use your finger!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Oh! Rex sticks a finger in Buzz’s re-set hole.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Okay, now what?

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: All right, let’s see... “Caution: Do not hold button for more than five seconds.” Abruptly, Buzz BEEPS loudly, falls limp, face plants. The others all look at Rex. Rex lifts his finger.  97

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: It’s not my fault! Suddenly, Buzz leaps up, knocking the Toys off him. He strides forward, flips his wrist radio.

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH BUZZ
dialogues.text: Bitdcora Espacial -- Me he despertado de hipersueno en un planeta extrano. (Star Log -- I’ve awakened from hyper- sleep on a strange planet.) The Toys are speechless. Hamm glares at Rex.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Now what did you do?!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: I did what you told me...! Buzz -- hyper-alert -- glances sideways, narrows his eyes

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH BUZZ
dialogues.text: Estoy rodeado por criaturas extrafas y desconozco sus intencidnes!!! (I'm surrounded by alien creatures of unknown intent!!! He whips around -- flamboyant Latin-style -- and trains h laser on Woody’s forehead.

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH BUZZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: é€Quién anda ahi? éAmigo? O Enemigo? (Who goes there -- Friend? Or foe?)

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Uh... Amigos! We’re all amigos! Satisfied, Buzz struts forward, greeting them.

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH BUZZ
dialogues.text: Me debo haber estrellado, y se me borr6é la memoria. (I must have crash landed and had my memory erased.) He approaches Woody, kisses both cheeks, strides off.

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH BUZZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Han visto a mi nave espacial? (Anyone seen my spaceship?)

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: We gotta switch him back!  98

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: How do we do that?

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: (re: manual) I dunno! That part’s in Spanish! Patrol Truck lights pass by under the hall door.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: We don’t have time for this! C’mon! Woody grabs Buzz, hustles him toward the playground door.

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH BUZZ
dialogues.text: Mi nave. éLo encontraste? !Excelente! (My spaceship? You know where it is? Excellent! ) They pass the Lifer, watching from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: LIFER
dialogues.text: Good luck, Cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessie, Bullseye, and Mrs. Potato Head wait inside a concrete pipe. Spotlights survey the playground.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: (points) Here they come! Woody, Hamm, Rex, Slinky, and Barbie steal across the playground. Spanish Buzz, trailing behind, does elaborate rear-guard defense poses. Woody has to grab him and pull him along. They duck into the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: What took you so long?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Things got complicated. Where's Potato Head?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: We haven’t seen him! Woody turns and peers out on the playground. Buzz, the last to arrive, sees Jessie. She turns to greet him.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Buzz...  99 Buzz is struck dumb. Time slows. His heart melts. He approaches, drops to his knees, takes Jessie’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH BUZZ
dialogues.text: Mi florecita del desierto...! Yo nunca he visto la belleza verdadera hasta esta noche! (My desert flower...! I have never seen true beauty til this night!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessie is speechless. She turns to the others.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Did you guys fix Buzz?

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Eh... Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Jessie, behind you! Someone’s coming! The Toys turn. A tall figure looms. Mr. Cucumber Head steps into the light -- irked, agitated.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: You would not believe...! What I’ve been through...! Tonight! Mrs. Potato Head goes to him.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Darling...! Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: I feel fresh! Healthy! It’s terrible!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: You've lost weight! And so tall! Bullseye nudges Potato Head’s torso toward him.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Ahhh, you’re a sight for detachable eyes! He plucks his eyes out and plants them on the spud.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: The Jungle Gym slide. A Patrol Truck drives by. Slinky slides down, pops out the bottom, looks both ways. At the top of the slide, Woody holds Slinky’s back end. The tail wags.  100

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, all clear!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PLAYGROUND
dialogues.text: The Toys shoot out the bottom of the slide, scamper off. They huddle behind the spring of an animal rocking swing.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Almost there! Jessie darts out, with others close behind. The lights of a Patrol Truck approach.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Back up, back up! Woody backs into the shadows with Bullseye and the Aliens The Truck pulls up and stops. Jessie looks back, sees Woody and the others still hiding Woody gestures “We’ll go around”. Jessie does a thumbs-up Woody and the Aliens ride Bullseye across the playground swing set. They stop abruptly. Big Baby is sitting on the last swing, CREAKING back and forth, gazing up at the moo Bullseye and Woody tip-toe behind Big Baby, approach the wood siding for the swing set area. Bullseye leaps over the siding but the last Alien falls to the ground. SQUEAK Big Baby swivels his head 180 degrees. Woody, Bullseye, et al lie low behind the siding plank -- in the shadows, amid plastic shovels and buckets. Big Baby dismounts, walks toward their hiding place. Woody looks around desperately. Big Baby reaches the wood siding, looks over. No one’s there. Looks up and down. He walks off. HOLD ON an overturned plastic bucket. Woody and Bullseye peek out from underneath, share a relieved look. Jessie, watching from the bushes, sighs with relief. Abruptly, Spanish Buzz grabs her, yanks her to him. As Jessie stands awkwardly, Spanish Buzz performs a solemn, impassioned courtship dance around her. Finally, Spanish Buzz takes Jessie in his arms.  101

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH BUZZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: iVen conmigo! iTe mostraré las Maravillas de la galaxia, y juntos lucharemos contra el despiadado Zurg! (Come with me! I will show you the wonders of the galaxy, and together we will fight the evil Zurg!) He plucks a dandelion, offers it to her. At that moment, Woody pushes through the bushes -- safe. Jessie leaves Buzz, runs and gives Woody an impulsive hug

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Woody! Thank goodness!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: C'mon! We’re almost there! He and Jessie leads the Toys off, REVEALING Spanish Buzz stunned and heartbroken. He throws down his dandelion.

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH BUZZ
dialogues.text: El Vaquero...!!! Mad with jealousy, he narrows his eyes and runs after the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody leads the Toys to the trash chute. He jumps -- trying to grab the handle -- but can’t quite reach it.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Buzz, c’mere, gimme a lift! Buzz, smoldering, steps forward, dramatically pushes Wood aside. With a lovelorn glance at Jessie, he hits a button

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH BUZZ
dialogues.text: Buzz Lightyear al rescate! (Buzz Lightyear to the rescue!) Buzz steps to the chute, jumps up in a series of crazy, acrobatic moves, and grabs the handle, pulling it down.

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH BUZZ
dialogues.text: Abierto...!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Way to go, Buzz! C’mon, everyone! The Toys boost each other up onto the trash chute lid.  102

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody climbs in the chute with the others and peers down. POV -- The grimy metal chute recedes into blackness.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Is it safe?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I guess I'll find out... Woody begins a controlled slide down -- feet first, hand bracing. He slips and it becomes an uncontrolled slide. He scrambles for traction, eases to a stop at the bottom. He gets up, stands at the edge of the slide’s precipice. ANGLE -- An alley. The trash chute cantilevers over a hal closed dumpster. Above him, stars twinkle -- freedom.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Woody...! You okay?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Come on down. But not all at once.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What’d he say?

dialogues.speaker: HAMM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I think he said, “All at once”. NOISES.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No...! No! No! No! No! Too late. The Toys slide down together.

dialogues.speaker: TOYS REX
dialogues.text: Whoa! Watch out! Geronimo...!!! They collide with Woody. Woody windmills his arms at the edge of the chute. Jessie grabs him, pulls him to safety.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jess. Spanish Buzz looks about, confused and deeply disappointe

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH BUZZ
dialogues.text: Donde esta mi nave...?! (Where’s my spaceship

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Slink...? Think you can make it?  103

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: I might be old, but I still got a spring in my step. He backs up, then leaps over the open pit to the closed l of the dumpster. He lands hard, clutches a metal handle.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: He did it!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: All right, Slinky-kins!

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Okay! Climb across! Suddenly, two pink paws step in front of Slinky. He looks up. Lotso looms over him, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: You lost, 1i’l doggy...? Lotso kicks Slinky’s paws. He retracts, falling from the lid. The Toys pull him to safety. Behind Lotso, his Gang hops off a wall and joins him on t dumpster lid. Lotso notices Woody among the others.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, well...! Look who’s back! A NOISE. The Toys turn. Lotso’s henchman -- Stretch, the Octopus -- clambers down the chute, blocking an escape. The Lifer Phone wheels into view -- wheels wobbling, one eye broken, frayed phone dangling. His voice is hoarse.

dialogues.speaker: LIFER
dialogues.text: (via handset) I’m sorry, Cowboy! They broke me...! Lotso turns to the Toys, as cheerful as ever.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: (incredulous ) What are you doin’?! Runnin’ back to your kid? He don’ want you no more!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: That’s a lie!

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Is it? Tell me this, Sheriff -- if your kid loves you so much, why is he leavin’?  104 CLOSE ON -- Woody, fuming. He has no answer.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Y’think you’re special, Cowboy? You're a piece of plastic! You were made to be thrown away! VROOM! A garbage truck turns into the far end of the alle and RUMBLES toward them. Lotso turns.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Speak of the devil...! (turns back) Now we need toys in our Caterpillar Room. And you need to avoid that truck. Why don’t you come on back, join our family again? He smiles. Woody seethes -- at a loss for words. Jessie steps past him, eyes burning.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: This isn’t a family, it’s a prison! You're a liar and a bully and I'd rather rot in this dumpster than join any family of yours! Barbie steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Jessie’s right! Authority should derive from the consent of the governed! Not from the threat of force! Hamm and Potato Head share a glance -- Huh? lLotso grins.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: If that’s what you want...! He bangs his cane. Stretch, the Octopus, begins to prod the Toys toward the precipice. Abruptly, Ken bursts from the shadows -- still in his underwear.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Barbie! Wait...! Everyone turns. He runs to Lotso.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't do this, Lotso...!

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: She’s a Barbie doll, Ken! There’s a hundred million just like her!  105

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Not to me there’s not! He glances at her. She sighs. Lotso picks up Ken.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Fine! Why don’t you join her?! He tosses Ken across the dumpster chasm. The Toys grab him, pull him to safety. Barbie hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: Oh, Ken! Ken stands and addresses Lotso’s Gang, earnest and heroic

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Everyone! Listen! Sunnyside could be cool and groovy if we treated each other fair! (points) It’s Lotso! He’s made us into a pyramid and he put himself on top! Lotso’s Gang eyes each other. There’s a shift in sympathy but no one wants to stick their neck out. Lotso is amused

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Anyone concur with Ken? No one moves. The truck RUMBLES closer -- two dumpsters away. Lotso turns to the Toys. His face hardens.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn’t throw you away. Your kid did. Ain’t one kid ever loved a toy, really! Chew on that when you’re at the dump! He turns away. Woody steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Wait...! What about Daisy? Lotso keeps a steely composure.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Daisy...? You used to do everything with her!

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Yeah -- then she threw us out!  106

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No -- she lost you!

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: She replaced us!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (pointing) She replaced you! And if you couldn't have her, no one could! You lied to Big Baby and you been lying ever since! Woody yanks something from his holster. It’s the rusty ol pendant, “My Heart Belongs To: DAISY”. Lotso is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Where’d you get that...?!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: She loved you, Lotso...

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: She never loved me!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: ..-As much as any kid ever loved a toy! Woody throws the pendant. It lands at Big Baby’s feet. Big Baby stares, electrified, at the pendant -- a token o his long-lost love. He picks it up. His lip trembles.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BABY
dialogues.text: Mama...! Lotso grabs the pendant. He pokes Big Baby like a bully.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: What -- you want your Mommy back? She never loved you! Don’t be such a baby! He throws it down and CRUSHES it with his cane. Big Baby’ face crumples. Lotso turns, yells at Stretch the Octopus.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Push ‘em in! All of ‘em! (to his Gang) This is what happens when you dummies try to think! He shoves Big Baby. Big Baby shrinks back, hurt. Stretch advances on Woody and the Toys. They teeter at th edge of the precipice. Lotso faces them, sneering.  107

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're all just trash, waitin’ to be thrown away! That’s all a toy is! Abruptly, Lotso is lifted from behind by Big Baby.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put me down! What're you doing? Big Baby carries him to the edge of the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Help me! Help! Around the dumpster, no one moves. Big Baby tosses Lotso into the dumpster. He lands in the shadows, looks up. With a CREAK, the Big Baby tugs at the open dumpster lid.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No...! Wait...! KLOON! Big Baby watches -- blank-eyed, pitiless -- as the lid SLAMS down, shutting Lotso in. No one can believe it.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: He’s gone!!!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Holy cow!!!

dialogues.speaker: BIG BABY
dialogues.text: Ah-pppbbb11lmmmmmmm...!!! He blows a RASPBERRY at Lotso. VROOOM! The Toys turn. The garbage truck is only 100 feet -- 15 seconds -- away.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: C’mon! Hurry! The Toys hop on the now-closed dumpster lid, rush to the retaining wall, and help each other clamber onto it. A SQUEAK. Woody turns. At the crack between the two lids are the three Aliens. One Alien is stuck. He struggles while the other two stand around ineffectually.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh...! For crying out loud! Woody glances at the approaching truck, then runs back.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Woody...! Woody yanks the Alien free. Spanish Buzz gestures.  108

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH BUZZ
dialogues.text: Vaquero, andale! (Cowboy, hurry!) The Aliens retreat to safety. Woody tries to follow, but pink paw grabs his leg. Woody tries to free himself, but the paw drags him slowly into the dumpster’s depths. The Toys watch, horrified, as Woody disappears. The truck turns and approaches the dumpster, fork out.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Oh, boy! Incoming! BA-BOOM! The truck’s forks slide into the dumpster and begin lifting it up. As it rises past the retaining wall Jessie and Buzz fearlessly jump onto the rising dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: C'mon! The other Toys follow. Barbie tries to follow too, but Ke holds her back.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Barbie, no...! They all try to lift the dumpster lid. It won’t budge. The dumpster rises up, up, up -- and begins to tilt. As the dumpster tilts, they start to lose their footing. As the dumpster nears vertical, the lid swings open and trash begins pouring into the truck. Woody calls out...

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Jess!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Woody! Woody falls into darkness. A FLASH of pink goes by -- Lotso tumbles past. The dumpster LURCHES to a stop. All the Toys fall into the truck. Barbie -- on the wall -- reaches forward.

dialogues.speaker: BARBIE
dialogues.text: She turns away, burying her head in Ken’s comforting arms  109

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Toys find themselves in darkness, awash in garbage.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Can you hear me?! Is everyone okay?!!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Of course not, you imbecile! We’re doomed! Buzz pulls himself from a mound of garbage. He GLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Everyone! Go to Buzz! C’mon!!! The Toys begin wading toward Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garbage truck rumbles through the streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Toys congregate around Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: We all here? Slinky...? Rex...? The truck lurches to a stop. The hydraulic motor STARTS. Woody looks up. A dumpster appears above them, tilting.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Against the wall, everybody! Quick! He leads the Toys to the front of the truck, seeking shelter. Buzz remains behind.

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH BUZZ
dialogues.text: Senorita! Senorita, donde estas...?! (Miss...! Miss, where are you...?!)

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Buzz...! He turns. Somewhere in the DARKNESS, her voice rings out. A trickle of garbage begins to sprinkle down from above.

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH BUZZ
dialogues.text: Senorita...! Buzz runs through the falling trash until he finds her pressed against the far wall -- terrified.  110 CLUMP! Something large falls behind them. They look up. Garbage is falling out of the dumpster directly above the Buzz takes Jessie’s hand and they run across the garbage truck bay, dodging madly while trash rains down upon them Against the back wall, the Toys watch, aghast.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: They’11 never make it! Buzz grabs Jessie and carries her -- dodging and weaving. A SCRAPING sound above.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Look out! Buzz and Jessie look up. An old TV set falls towards them Buzz lunges and tosses Jessie out of the way. She turns. CRASH!!! The TV smashes down on Buzz. A deluge of trash piles on top, burying him completely.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Buzz...!!! As the dumpster above recedes, Jessie runs forward and begins digging. The other Toys join her.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Anyone see him?!

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Over here, y'all! I found him! They rush over and drag Buzz from the pile. Buzz’s eyes are closed. Jessie pops his shield, shakes him.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Buzz, you okay?! Buzz! Buzz!!! No response. Jessie shakes him again. And again.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: No...! She hugs him, sobbing. A BEEP. Buzz jack-knifes forward, then lurches back. Jessie pulls away. Buzz sits up, eyes open -- disoriented He sniffs the air with distaste. Then he sees the others. The Toys gape at him in open-mouthed wonder.  111 Buzz frowns.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: That wasn’t me, was it?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Oh, Buzz! You’re back!!! You’re back, you're back, you’re back!!! She throws her arms around him, hugs him tight.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Yes, I’m back! (beat) Where’ve I been?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Beyond Infinity, Space Ranger!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Woody! Woody smiles -- partners again. Buzz looks around.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But... Where are we now?!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: (excitable) In a garbage truck on the way to the dump! Buzz’s smile freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garbage truck drives in the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck grinds to a halt. The BEEP-BEEP-BEEP backing-up alarm begins to sound. The Toys look around.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Everyone -- stay together! Everything lurches. The truck bay begins to tilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garbage truck tilts up -- higher and higher. Trash begins pouring out the back, onto the dump below.  112

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back flap opens, allowing garbage to spill out. A trash pit is revealed below. The Toys begin sliding out.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Hold on! We’re going in...!

dialogues.speaker: TOYS
dialogues.text: Whoa...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garbage truck extends fully, tilting 70 degrees. The stream of garbage becomes a torrent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Toys cling together, screaming, as they slide out int the open night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody lands on a trash heap -- Oooff! A plastic bag whips by. He sits up. He’s in a vast, wind-blown landfill. Nearby, Hamm and Rex unearth themselves. Mr. Potato Head helps Mrs. Potato Head up.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: You got all your pieces? The Aliens pop up. One points to some heavy machinery -- with a giant claw -- in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN
dialogues.text: The Cla-a-a-aw! They toddle off toward it.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Hey! Guys, no...! No!!! Suddenly, the trio of Aliens is bathed in headlights. Before anyone can react, a bulldozer passes over them... Just like that, they’re gone.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: My Babies...!!! A blinding LIGHT pours over her and envelops the Toys.  113 Woody turns. A bulldozer -- with giant, studded wheels an a massive grate -- is heading right at them. Rex SCREAMS. The Toys are pushed backward toward a trench.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hang on! They tumble as the bulldozer pushes them over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Toys land on a conveyor belt entering a dark tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody sits up and watches the light receding behind them. The other Toys gather round.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Woody! What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: We'll be okay if we stay toge--... VWOOSH! Slinky is pulled up OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Slinky...!

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Woody...! Slinky is fixed to a fast-moving conveyor belt above them Woody runs after him.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Slinky, get down from there! A hammer shoots up and CLANKS on the belt, narrowly missi Slinky. All around them, other pieces of metal begin FLYING UP and sticking to the ceiling belt. Jessie yells.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: It’s a magnet! Watch out! High above, Slinky looks around.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Uh, you might wanna take a look at this! The Toys scramble up a pile of debris.  114 Ahead is a Shredder -- two fast-spinning vertical cylinde that shred everything on the belt. Buzz sees a lunch box near him starting to quiver....

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Quick! Grab something metal! He grabs it and is pulled up to the magnetic belt. Woody grabs a metal handle and flies up, sticking to the ceilin belt. Hamm dives into a nearby pot and is lifted upwards.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: You heard the guy...! Each Toy grabs a metal object and lifts -- CLUNK! -- to t ceiling. Rex, the last, grabs an aluminum can, a CD, etc.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: It’s not working!!! Finally, he grabs a metal fan and sails up to safety. Suddenly, a pink paw thrusts out from the belt below.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Help...! Help me!!! Woody turns. Lotso is pinned under a golf bag.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m stuck! Help!!! Please! Woody looks at the approaching shredder. He lets go.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Woody...! Woody lands on the belt, runs back to Lotso.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Don’t thank me yet. Woody struggles to lift the bag. Buzz drops down next to Woody. Jessie eyes the approaching shredder.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Buzz...!!! Woody...?!!! Woody and Buzz push together. They still can’t move it. Woody pulls out a golf club. The magnet tugs it upward. Buzz grabs it. Together, they pull it down and jam it under the bag for leverage. The bag finally lifts...  115

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Go! Go! ...and Lotso scrambles out. Woody grabs Lotso. He and Buzz point the club skyward. They're pulled up to safety as the golf bag is pulverized Lotso looks back at the shredder, then at Woody.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Thank you, Sheriff...!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: We're all in this together. (turns) Right guys...? All the Toys have vanished.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guys?!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Woody! Down here! Jessie and the others wave from a conveyer belt far below Woody and Buzz let go and plummet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody, Buzz and Lotso land on the bed of a big, fast-movi conveyer belt with metal walls. The Toys gather around.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Woody! The toothed belt begins to ascend upwards.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Woody! Look! I can see daylight! We’re gonna be okay! Rex points to a bright amber GLOW at the top of the belt. The toys scramble forward. Woody’s smile drops.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I don’t think that’s daylight... FAST TRACK -- At the end of the conveyer belt, garbage falls into a burning, churning vortex.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Run!!!  116 Unable to jump off, the Toys begin running down the belt. They dodge, duck and hurdle over the coming trash, but they’re no match for the speed of the rising conveyor. Lotso trips, falls. A pulsing blue LIGHT. He looks up. High on the wall ahead is an Emergency Stop button. A ladder leads to the button. Lotso leaps up, grabs the bottom rung. He can’t pull himself up.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Sheriff...! The button! Help me! The Toys look back, see Lotso. As they pass, Woody, Buzz and Jessie boost Lotso up.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Go!!! Go!!! Hit the button! Lotso scrambles up the ladder toward the glowing button. The Toys are carried up the conveyor belt toward the pit. The Toys watch Lotso -- receding -- as he climbs. Lotso stays focussed on the button above him. The Toys reach the belt’s acme -- heels at the edge of th waterfall of trash cascading to a melting, churning vorte

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hurry!!! Lotso reaches the walkway where the blue button glows. He turns and looks -- malevolent -- at the helpless Toys.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just push it! Push it!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
