dialogues.text: Push it!!! Lotso smirks, gives a salute.

dialogues.speaker: LOTSO
dialogues.text: Where’s your kid now, Sheriff?! He turns, runs off down the walkway.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Lotso...!!!  117 The Toys YELL as they tumble off the belt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Toys land in a giant vortex of trash being sucked dow into the glowing eye of an incinerator. It’s chaos -- trash tumbles over itself as sparks and ash fly through the air. The ROAR is overwhelming. Woody stands and starts trying to climb out. The Toys do the same, climbing desperately, fighting against the trash tumbling into the vortex of fire. They slip, fall, get up and slip again. It’s a nightmare no matter how fast they climb, they inexorably slide backwards. Rex slides past Woody, towards the incinerator

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Rex!!! Woody grabs Rex’s hand, slides further toward the inferno They are all being pulled inescapably downward. There’s no way out. Jessie looks at Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Buzz...! What do we do? Buzz looks at her. He reaches out, takes her hand. Jessie grabs Bullseye’s hoof. Slinky takes Hamm’s hand. Hamm reaches out to Rex. The Potato Heads hold each other Mr. Potato Head grabs Rex. Buzz reaches out to Woody... Woody takes Buzz’s hand, and the circle is complete. As they approach the vortex, heat waves blast their faces The Toys close their eyes, turn away. Woody stares at the fire, shuts his eyes. This is the end.  118 A LIGHT from above shines in Woody’s face. He opens his eyes. A giant mechanical Claw lowers towards them. The Claw plunges into the trash around them, closing them in its grip, then raises them up. They soar into the air, away from the ROARING incinerator Woody looks around in disbelief. The Claw spins, passing in front of the crane booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the booth, the Aliens man the joysticks.

dialogues.speaker: ALIENS
dialogues.text: The Clawwwww!!! They lean into the joystick, steering the Claw to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Claw lowers and opens, dropping the Toys to earth. Th spill out, COUGHING and GROANING like shipwreck survivors Woody sits up, looks around. Rex pops up through trash.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Whew...! They have faced death and survived, and are profoundly shaken. Potato Head stares at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Y’know all that bad stuff I said about Andy’s attic? I take it all back.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: You’re darn tootin’!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: You said it! Buzz and Jessie sit up, still holding hands. She looks at him, smiles. He smiles and holds her gaze. Mrs. Potato Head takes Mr. Potato Head’s hand.  119

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Oh, darling! You were so brave! A SQUEAK. The Potato Heads turn, see the Aliens approach.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You saved our lives...!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: And we... Are eternally grateful! Potato Head scoops them into his arms for a big, proud hu

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My boys...!

dialogues.speaker: ALIENS
dialogues.text: Daaddddyyyy...!!! Hamm looks around.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Hey! Where’s that furball Lotso?

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: I'd like to loosen his stitching!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Forget it, guys. He’s not worth it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lotso limps toward the dump exit. A NOISE. He turns, then drops, freezing. A truck’s wheels SCREECH to a halt in front of Lotso. A door OPENS and SHUTS. FOOTSTEPS. A hand picks him up.

dialogues.speaker: GARBAGE MAN ONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: GARBAGE MAN TWO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Whatcha got?

dialogues.speaker: GARBAGE MAN ONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I had me one a these when I was a kid! He buries his nose in Lotso’s tummy, inhales.

dialogues.speaker: GARBAGE MAN ONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (nostalgic rapture) Strawberries...!  120

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck exits the dump -- Lotso strapped to the grill. He comes to life, panicked. On the grill are a couple of muddy, bug-spattered Plushies, including a sad-eyed FROG.

dialogues.speaker: FROG
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy...! (Lotso turns) ..-Y’might wanna keep yer mouth shut! The others SNICKER. Lotso WHIMPERS. The truck RUMBLES off ANGLE -- The truck passes, REVEALING the Toys, unaware of Lotso’s karmic comeuppance. Jessie sees Woody lagging.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: C’mon, Woody -- we gotta get you home!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: That’s right, “College Boy”!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: But... What about you guys? Maybe the attic’s not such a great idea. He glances at them, uneasy. Jessie steps to him.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: We’re Andy’s Toys, Woody...

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: We'll be there for him. Together. Woody smiles.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I just hope he hasn’t left yet...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! Wait, I’11 check! She covers her good eye, concentrates.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s still packing...! (GASPS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...-But he’s almost done!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: He lives halfway across town...!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: We'll never get there in time!  121 The Toys glance at each other. Then, distantly, comes the air-guitar WAILING of Andy’s Neighborhood Garbage Man. The Toys turn, see him a dozen yards away. They brighten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy’s loading up his hatchback with boxes. Molly’s on th lawn playing with Buster. As the garbage truck passes...

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: C’mere, boy. C’mon, Buster!

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Is that it, honey? You got everything?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, just a few more boxes in my room. At the curb, REVEAL the Toys hiding behind a garbage can. Woody peeks around, gestures to the other Toys.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Okay, c’mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON SPIGOT -- Woody’s hand comes in, turns it. The Toys huddle while Woody hoses them off. Buzz closes his helmet. The Toys react to the cold water.

dialogues.speaker: TOYS
dialogues.text: Eeeaauggh...!!! Brrr...!!! Stop!!!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: That’s enough, that’s enough, that’s enough! !

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: All right, go! Go, go! The Toys run off. Potato Head pulls off his nose, blows out a spray of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slinky heaves himself up to the edge of the garage roof. One by one, the Toys scurry up his Slink, then make their way along the roof towards Andy’s open window.  122 INT. ANDY’S ROOM - DAY Buzz and Woody peer in.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: All clear...! They clamber through the window, jump to the floor. The other Toys follow, scrambling across the room. Mrs. Potato Head stops, puts a hand over her working eye.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSITION
dialogues.text: POV -- Under the bed, looking out. Mrs. Potato Head’s fee are in front of us, facing away.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There you are...! The feet turn and a hand reaches TOWARD US, GRABBING the subjective eye.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSITION
dialogues.text: She pops her eye back in, blinks... And GIGGLES, tickled. The Toys climb into a box marked “Attic”. Buzz helps them On the desk is a box marked “College”. Woody heads for it He reaches the box, turns. This may be the last time he ever sees the other Toys. He scrambles back toward Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Buzz... Buzz turns. Woody offers a hand. They shake.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This isn’t good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, Woody... Woody looks up. Slinky lowers a paw.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-Have fun at college!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Yeah, but not too much fun! Woody laughs, shakes hands with Slinky.  123

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Woody, take care of Andy.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: He’s a good kid. Tell him to get a haircut.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I will. Woody sees Jessie.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jessie -- you'll be okay in the attic?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: ‘Course I will. Besides... (leans in) .--I know about Buzz’s “Spanish Mode”.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: My what...? He turns, confused. Woody and Jessie share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Honey, you want some food for the road?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll get something on the way. Woody turns to Buzz -- there’s so much he wants to say. Buzz just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: You know where to find us, Cowboy. Woody smiles. He turns, runs to the desk. Buzz climbs in the Attic box with the others. On the desk, Woody jumps on the edge of the College box, looks back at his friends. FOOTSTEPS climb the stairs. Woody gives Buzz a salute. Buzz smiles, salutes back. Woody lowers into the College box. The Toys duck in the Attic box, pull the flaps shut just as Andy and Mom enter

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Did you say goodbye to Molly?  124

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Mom, we've said goodbye like ten times! Mom stops, suddenly overwhelmed. The room is empty.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Oh, Andy...! Andy, beside her, is abashed.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Mom...! It’s okay...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE COLLEGE BOX
dialogues.text: Woody quietly peeks out the hand holes. POV -- Woody can half-see Mom hug Andy.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I know, it’s just... I wish I could always be with you.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You will be, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: ON WOODY
dialogues.text: He turns and glances off, noticing something.

dialogues.speaker: THE PHOTO
dialogues.text: Of young Andy, playing with Woody and the other Toys.

dialogues.speaker: TRACK IN ON
dialogues.text: Woody. Mom and Andy’s words echo in his head. WOODY POV -- His GAZE SHIFTS from Andy-holding-Woody to Woody-with-the-other-Toys. Suddenly, Woody half-smiles -- an epiphany. Sadness and uncertainty are replaced by happiness and determination. FOOTSTEPS and collar JINGLES approach. Molly steps to the room’s threshold with Buster.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Hey... Aren’t you gonna say goodbye to Buster? Andy and Mom step into the hallway.  125

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Of course I will...! (to Buster) Who’s a good doggie?! Who’s a good doggie?!!! I’m gonna miss you! While Andy scratches Buster’s belly, Woody jumps out of t box, grabs a pen and a sticky note. He sneaks across the room, jumps on the Attic box, starts frantically writing. Buster starts BARKING. Woody finishes writing, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: He’s telling you to go already.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: C’mon, get the rest of your things. Woody gasps, looks up at the door.

dialogues.speaker: TRACK IN
dialogues.text: Andy walks in. Mom and Molly stay in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Okay, Buster, don’t let Molly near my stuff. Andy turns, crouches to pick up the Attic box. He stops, noticing the yellow Post-It on the box top. He opens the flaps, finding all of his Toys.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey...! He digs through them -- pulling a few out, making sure they’re all there -- smiling with fondness and relief. He picks up the Post-It, reads it. He calls out.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, Mom... So, you really think I should donate these? Mom answers from the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s up to you, honey. Whatever you want to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy cruises, looking for an address. A box with “Attic” crossed out sits in the passenger seat. The car slows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy grabs the box and gets out. TRACK IN -- The hand slot of the College box, left behind POV - COLLEGE BOX -- Andy crosses the street and approach the house. Andy stops, glances at the box. On the Post-It is written

dialogues.speaker: DONATE TO
dialogues.text: Bonnie 1225 Sycamore Road TILT UP -- The address on the front gate. It matches. Andy sees Bonnie playing in the front yard, while her Mom and Dad garden nearby.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: No! Don’t go in there! The bakery is haunted...!!! (another voice: ) Shhhhhh!!! Are you crazy?! You’1l wake up all the ghosts! Andy watches Bonnie play -- exuberant and unself-consciou BONNIE (CONT’D) Look out! The ghosts are throwing pies! Splat! Splat! Splat! Bonnie notices Andy and immediately stops playing.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mom...? Bonnie’s Mom looks over, sees Andy. She stands. BONNIE’S MOM Andy...!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Hi! Andy lets himself in the gate.  127 BONNIE’S MOM Wow! Look at you! I hear you’re off to college?!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Right now, actually. BONNIE’S MOM So, what can we do for you? Bonnie goes and stands behind her Mom.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Uhh... I have some toys here. BONNIE’S MOM Ohhh...! You hear that, Bonnie? Bonnie peeks around her Mom, curious.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: So you're Bonnie? He hunches down so he’s eye to eye with her.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m Andy. Someone told me you’re really good with toys. These are mine, but I’m going away now, so I need someone really special to play with them. Bonnie is uncertain. Andy sits in front of her, cross- legged. He opens the box, pulls out Jessie and Bullseye.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is Jessie -- the roughest, toughest cowgirl in the whole West. She loves critters, but none more’n her best pal, Bullseye. (whinnies; then, as Jessie) Yee-haw! Here. Bonnie looks at her Mom, who nods. She walks forward. And gives Jessie and Bullseye to her. A smile escapes Bonnie. Andy pulls out Rex.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is Rex -- the meanest, most terrifying dinosaur who ever lived. (dinosaur voice) “Raaawwwrrrrr...!!!" He thrusts Rex at her. Bonnie backs up, grins, takes him.  128 Andy pulls out the Potato Heads.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Potato Heads -- Mister and Missus. You gotta keep ‘em together ‘cause they’re madly in love. Bonnie nods, takes them. Andy pulls out Slinky and Hamm.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now Slinky here is as loyal as any dog you could want. But Hamm? He’1l keep your money safe... He drops a quarter into Hamm’s slot.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...-but he’s also one of the most dastardly villains of all time... (Hamm voice) “,..Evil Dr. Pork Chop!” Bonnie smiles, takes them. He pulls out the three Aliens.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These little dudes are froma strange, alien world -- Pizza Planet! She smiles. He hands them to her, then pulls out Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And this is Buzz Lightyear -- the coolest toy ever. Look, he can fly... (deploys wings) ..-And shoot lasers... (fires laser) He’s sworn to protect the galaxy from the evil Emperor Zurg! Andy hands over Buzz. Bonnie presses a button on him.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: “To Infinity... And Beyond!!!" Bonnie looks up, happily surrounded by Andy’s toys.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Now, you gotta promise to take good care of these guys. They mean a lot to me. Bonnie nods. She glances in the box. Her eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: My cowboy!  129 Andy looks down, sees Woody lying in the box.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Woody...? What’s he doing in there? He lifts Woody out. Bonnie points.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: “There’s a snake in my boot!” Andy -- amazed -- pulls Woody’s pull-string.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (voice-box) “There’s a snake in my boot!” Bonnie giggles and reaches for him, but Andy instinctivel pulls Woody away. Bonnie looks at Andy, confused. Andy looks down at Woody, makes a decision. He holds Woody out -- gentle and serious.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Now, Woody -- he’s been my pal as long as I can remember. He’s brave, like a cowboy should be. And kind, and smart. But the thing that makes Woody special? Is he’1ll never give up on you -- ever. He’ll be there for you, no matter what. Y’think you can take care of him for me? (she nods) Okay, then. He hands Woody to Bonnie. She hugs him. Andy suddenly grabs Hamm.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, no! Dr. Pork Chop’s attacking the haunted bakery! Pchoo! Pchoo! Without missing a beat, Bonnie joins in the play.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Oh, no! The ghosts are getting away! Woody’11 stop ‘em!! She swoops Woody in the air. Andy grabs Slinky and gives chase. They EXIT FRAME, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Pchoo! Pchoo! Pchoo!  130 EXT. BONNIE’S HOUSE - LATE AFTERNOON - MONTAGE Bonnie and Andy play together with all their Toys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy walks to his car, turns. Bonnie stands on the porch, the Toys scattered at her feet. She clutches Woody. Bonnie makes Woody’s arm wave at Andy. Andy smiles. He gets in his car. He takes one last look at all his Toy on Bonnie’s porch, and Woody in Bonnie’s arms...

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Thanks, guys. ...And pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Look, Mommy! They’re all playing together! Bonnie puts Woody down and runs to her mother’s arms. BONNIE’S MOM (0.C.) C’mon -- let’s get some lunch. She scoops up Bonnie, swings her around. Mother and daughter laugh as they step into the house. On the porch, the Toys come to life, sit up. Woody watches Andy drive away.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: So long, partner. Buzz puts an arm around Woody. They watch Andy drive off. The other Toys gather around, and we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...-Blue sky, and fluffy clouds.
